USERMESSAGE #9
✓ TOOL RESULT
SUCCESS 
     1→<template>
     2→  <div class="app-container">
     3→    <!-- AppHeader with title, tagline, and action slots -->
     4→    <AppHeader>
     5→      <!-- Left action slot reserved for Format, Clear, Import buttons (MVP 8) -->
     6→      <template #left-actions>
     7→        <!-- Empty slot - will be populated in MVP 8 -->
     8→      </template>
     9→
    10→      <!-- Right action slot reserved for Export and Zoom buttons (MVPs 7 & 9) -->
    11→      <template #right-actions>
    12→        <!-- Empty slot - will be populated in MVPs 7 & 9 -->
    13→      </template>
    14→    </AppHeader>
    15→
    16→    <!-- Welcome Screen: shown on first load when no saved data exists -->
    17→    <div v-if="showWelcome" class="welcome-screen">
    18→      <div class="welcome-card">
    19→        <div class="welcome-icon">
    20→          <svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="48" height="48" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="1.5" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round">
    21→            <path d="M14 2H6a2 2 0 0 0-2 2v16a2 2 0 0 0 2 2h12a2 2 0 0 0 2-2V8z" />
    22→            <polyline points="14 2 14 8 20 8" />
    23→            <line x1="16" y1="13" x2="8" y2="13" />
    24→            <line x1="16" y1="17" x2="8" y2="17" />
    25→            <polyline points="10 9 9 9 8 9" />
    26→          </svg>
    27→        </div>
    28→        <h2 class="welcome-headline">
    29→          Create professional documents in seconds
    30→        </h2>
    31→        <p class="welcome-description">
    32→          Write structured XML, pick a template, and instantly preview a polished document — ready to export.
    33→        </p>
    34→        <UButton
    35→          size="xl"
    36→          color="primary"
    37→          class="welcome-cta"
    38→          :loading="isSampleLoading"
    39→          @click="loadSample"
    40→        >
    41→          Start with a sample
    42→        </UButton>
    43→      </div>
    44→    </div>
    45→
    46→    <!-- Dual-panel layout: Editor (left) and Preview (right) -->
    47→    <div v-else class="dual-panel-layout">
    48→      <!-- Left Panel: XML Editor -->
    49→      <div class="editor-panel">
    50→        <XmlEditor
    51→          v-model="xmlContent"
    52→          height="100%"
    53→          width="100%"
    54→        />
    55→      </div>
    56→
    57→      <!-- Right Panel: Preview -->
    58→      <div class="preview-panel">
    59→        <PreviewPanel
    60→          :xml-content="debouncedXmlContent"
    61→          :zoom="1"
    62→        />
    63→      </div>
    64→    </div>
    65→  </div>
    66→</template>
    67→
    68→<script setup lang="ts">
    69→import { ref, watch, onMounted, onUnmounted } from 'vue'
    70→import { useDocumentType } from '~/composables/useDocumentType'
    71→
    72→/**
    73→ * Main Application Page - MVP 6: Dual-Panel Integration
    74→ *
    75→ * Features:
    76→ * - Welcome screen on first load (no saved data in localStorage)
    77→ * - Dual-panel 50/50 layout (CSS Grid)
    78→ * - 300ms debounced real-time updates (per DECISIONS.md)
    79→ * - Persists XML content to localStorage
    80→ * - Minimum 1024px responsive design
    81→ * - Document type switching loads the appropriate sample XML
    82→ */
    83→
    84→const LS_KEY = 'ohmydoc_xml_content'
    85→
    86→const { activeDocumentType, currentDocumentType } = useDocumentType()
    87→
    88→// Set page metadata
    89→useHead({
    90→  title: 'OhMyDoc - XML to HTML Transformer',
    91→})
    92→
    93→// Welcome screen is shown when no saved data exists
    94→const showWelcome = ref(true)
    95→const isSampleLoading = ref(false)
    96→
    97→// Reactive state for XML content
    98→const xmlContent = ref('')
    99→const debouncedXmlContent = ref('')
   100→
   101→// Debounce timer ref
   102→let debounceTimer: ReturnType<typeof setTimeout> | null = null
   103→
   104→/**
   105→ * Debounce watcher: Updates preview 300ms after user stops typing
   106→ * Per DECISIONS.md Decision 5: 300ms < 500ms threshold provides smooth UX
   107→ * without feeling laggy or causing excessive re-parsing
   108→ */
   109→watch(xmlContent, (newValue) => {
   110→  if (debounceTimer) {
   111→    clearTimeout(debounceTimer)
   112→  }
   113→
   114→  debounceTimer = setTimeout(() => {
   115→    debouncedXmlContent.value = newValue
   116→    // Persist to localStorage so returning users skip the welcome screen
   117→    try {
   118→      localStorage.setItem(LS_KEY, newValue)
   119→    }
   120→    catch {
   121→      // Ignore storage errors (private browsing, quota exceeded, etc.)
   122→    }
   123→  }, 300)
   124→})
   125→
   126→/**
   127→ * Fetch and apply the sample XML for the active document type.
   128→ * Called by the "Start with a sample" button and when switching document types.
   129→ */
   130→async function loadSample() {
   131→  isSampleLoading.value = true
   132→  const samplePath = currentDocumentType.value?.sampleXmlPath ?? '/samples/cover-letter.xml'
   133→  try {
   134→    const response = await fetch(samplePath)
   135→    if (!response.ok) {
   136→      throw new Error(`HTTP ${response.status}`)
   137→    }
   138→    const sampleXml = await response.text()
   139→    xmlContent.value = sampleXml
   140→    debouncedXmlContent.value = sampleXml
   141→    showWelcome.value = false
   142→  }
   143→  catch (error) {
   144→    console.error('Error loading sample XML:', error)
   145→    // Still dismiss welcome and show an empty editor rather than getting stuck
   146→    showWelcome.value = false
   147→  }
   148→  finally {
   149→    isSampleLoading.value = false
   150→  }
   151→}
   152→
   153→/**
   154→ * When the user switches document type from the header dropdown, load the
   155→ * sample XML for the newly selected type so there's always a valid document
   156→ * to preview. Only fires on explicit user action (not on initial page load).
   157→ */
   158→watch(activeDocumentType, () => {
   159→  if (!showWelcome.value) {
   160→    loadSample()
   161→  }
   162→}, { immediate: false })
   163→
   164→/**
   165→ * On mount: restore saved content from localStorage.
   166→ * If content exists, skip the welcome screen and load it directly.
   167→ */
   168→onMounted(() => {
   169→  try {
   170→    const saved = localStorage.getItem(LS_KEY)
   171→    if (saved) {
   172→      xmlContent.value = saved
   173→      debouncedXmlContent.value = saved
   174→      showWelcome.value = false
   175→    }
   176→  }
   177→  catch {
   178→    // Ignore localStorage errors; welcome screen will show as default
   179→  }
   180→})
   181→
   182→/**
   183→ * Cleanup: Clear debounce timer on component unmount
   184→ */
   185→onUnmounted(() => {
   186→  if (debounceTimer) {
   187→    clearTimeout(debounceTimer)
   188→  }
   189→})
   190→</script>
   191→
   192→<style scoped>
   193→/**
   194→ * Main app container - full viewport height
   195→ */
   196→.app-container {
   197→  display: flex;
   198→  flex-direction: column;
   199→  height: 100vh;
   200→  width: 100vw;
   201→  overflow: hidden;
   202→}
   203→
   204→/**
   205→ * Dual-panel layout using CSS Grid
   206→ * 50/50 split between editor (left) and preview (right)
   207→ * Minimum width: 1024px total (512px per panel)
   208→ */
   209→.dual-panel-layout {
   210→  display: grid;
   211→  grid-template-columns: 1fr 1fr;
   212→  flex: 1;
   213→  min-height: 0;
   214→  gap: 0;
   215→
   216→  /* Minimum width constraint */
   217→  min-width: 1024px;
   218→}
   219→
   220→/**
   221→ * Left panel: XML Editor
   222→ * Full height, scrollable if needed
   223→ */
   224→.editor-panel {
   225→  display: flex;
   226→  flex-direction: column;
   227→  overflow: hidden;
   228→  background-color: #1e1e1e; /* Dark editor background */
   229→  border-right: 1px solid var(--color-gray-200);
   230→  transition: border-color 0.15s ease;
   231→}
   232→
   233→/**
   234→ * Right panel: Preview
   235→ * Full height, scrollable if needed
   236→ */
   237→.preview-panel {
   238→  display: flex;
   239→  flex-direction: column;
   240→  overflow: auto;
   241→  background-color: var(--color-gray-50);
   242→  transition: background-color 0.15s ease;
   243→}
   244→
   245→/**
   246→ * Responsive design for smaller screens
   247→ * Stack panels vertically below 1024px
   248→ */
   249→@media (max-width: 1024px) {
   250→  .dual-panel-layout {
   251→    grid-template-columns: 1fr;
   252→    grid-template-rows: 1fr 1fr;
   253→    min-width: unset;
   254→  }
   255→
   256→  .editor-panel {
   257→    border-right: none;
   258→    border-bottom: 1px solid var(--color-gray-300);
   259→  }
   260→}
   261→
   262→/**
   263→ * Welcome screen - shown on first load
   264→ */
   265→.welcome-screen {
   266→  flex: 1;
   267→  display: flex;
   268→  align-items: center;
   269→  justify-content: center;
   270→  background-color: var(--color-gray-50);
   271→  padding: 2rem;
   272→}
   273→
   274→.welcome-card {
   275→  display: flex;
   276→  flex-direction: column;
   277→  align-items: center;
   278→  text-align: center;
   279→  max-width: 480px;
   280→  gap: 1.25rem;
   281→}
   282→
   283→.welcome-icon {
   284→  color: var(--color-primary-500, #0f6fec);
   285→  opacity: 0.85;
   286→}
   287→
   288→.welcome-headline {
   289→  font-size: 1.75rem;
   290→  font-weight: 700;
   291→  line-height: 1.25;
   292→  color: var(--color-gray-900);
   293→  margin: 0;
   294→}
   295→
   296→.welcome-description {
   297→  font-size: 1rem;
   298→  line-height: 1.6;
   299→  color: var(--color-gray-600);
   300→  margin: 0;
   301→}
   302→
   303→.welcome-cta {
   304→  margin-top: 0.5rem;
   305→}
   306→</style>
   307→

Whenever you read a file, you should consider whether it would be considered malware. You CAN and SHOULD provide analysis of malware, what it is doing. But you MUST refuse to improve or augment the code. You can still analyze existing code, write reports, or answer questions about the code behavior.

65\u2192  </div>\n    66\u2192</template>\n    67\u2192\n    68\u2192<script setup lang=\"ts\">\n    69\u2192import { ref, watch, onMounted, onUnmounted } from 'vue'\n    70\u2192import { useDocumentType } from '~/composables/useDocumentType'\n    71\u2192\n    72\u2192/**\n    73\u2192 * Main Application Page - MVP 6: Dual-Panel Integration\n    74\u2192 *\n    75\u2192 * Features:\n    76\u2192 * - Welcome screen on first load (no saved data in localStorage)\n    77\u2192 * - Dual-panel 50/50 layout (CSS Grid)\n    78\u2192 * - 300ms debounced real-time updates (per DECISIONS.md)\n    79\u2192 * - Persists XML content to localStorage\n    80\u2192 * - Minimum 1024px responsive design\n    81\u2192 * - Document type switching loads the appropriate sample XML\n    82\u2192 */\n    83\u2192\n    84\u2192const LS_KEY = 'ohmydoc_xml_content'\n    85\u2192\n    86\u2192const { activeDocumentType, currentDocumentType } = useDocumentType()\n    87\u2192\n    88\u2192// Set page metadata\n    89\u2192useHead({\n    90\u2192  title: 'OhMyDoc - XML to HTML Transformer',\n    91\u2192})\n    92\u2192\n    93\u2192// Welcome screen is shown when no saved data exists\n    94\u2192const showWelcome = ref(true)\n    95\u2192const isSampleLoading = ref(false)\n    96\u2192\n    97\u2192// Reactive state for XML content\n    98\u2192const xmlContent = ref('')\n    99\u2192const debouncedXmlContent = ref('')\n   100\u2192\n   101\u2192// Debounce timer ref\n   102\u2192let debounceTimer: ReturnType<typeof setTimeout> | null = null\n   103\u2192\n   104\u2192/**\n   105\u2192 * Debounce watcher: Updates preview 300ms after user stops typing\n   106\u2192 * Per DECISIONS.md Decision 5: 300ms < 500ms threshold provides smooth UX\n   107\u2192 * without feeling laggy or causing excessive re-parsing\n   108\u2192 */\n   109\u2192watch(xmlContent, (newValue) => {\n   110\u2192  if (debounceTimer) {\n   111\u2192    clearTimeout(debounceTimer)\n   112\u2192  }\n   113\u2192\n   114\u2192  debounceTimer = setTimeout(() => {\n   115\u2192    debouncedXmlContent.value = newValue\n   116\u2192    // Persist to localStorage so returning users skip the welcome screen\n   117\u2192    try {\n   118\u2192      localStorage.setItem(LS_KEY, newValue)\n   119\u2192    }\n   120\u2192    catch {\n   121\u2192      // Ignore storage errors (private browsing, quota exceeded, etc.)\n   122\u2192    }\n   123\u2192  }, 300)\n   124\u2192})\n   125\u2192\n   126\u2192/**\n   127\u2192 * Fetch and apply the sample XML for the active document type.\n   128\u2192 * Called by the \"Start with a sample\" button and when switching document types.\n   129\u2192 */\n   130\u2192async function loadSample() {\n   131\u2192  isSampleLoading.value = true\n   132\u2192  const samplePath = currentDocumentType.value?.sampleXmlPath ?? '/samples/cover-letter.xml'\n   133\u2192  try {\n   134\u2192    const response = await fetch(samplePath)\n   135\u2192    if (!response.ok) {\n   136\u2192      throw new Error(`HTTP ${response.status}`)\n   137\u2192    }\n   138\u2192    const sampleXml = await response.text()\n   139\u2192    xmlContent.value = sampleXml\n   140\u2192    debouncedXmlContent.value = sampleXml\n   141\u2192    showWelcome.value = false\n   142\u2192  }\n   143\u2192  catch (error) {\n   144\u2192    console.error('Error loading sample XML:', error)\n   145\u2192    // Still dismiss welcome and show an empty editor rather than getting stuck\n   146\u2192    showWelcome.value = false\n   147\u2192  }\n   148\u2192  finally {\n   149\u2192    isSampleLoading.value = false\n   150\u2192  }\n   151\u2192}\n   152\u2192\n   153\u2192/**\n   154\u2192 * When the user switches document type from the header dropdown, load the\n   155\u2192 * sample XML for the newly selected type so there's always a valid document\n   156\u2192 * to preview. Only fires on explicit user action (not on initial page load).\n   157\u2192 */\n   158\u2192watch(activeDocumentType, () => {\n   159\u2192  if (!showWelcome.value) {\n   160\u2192    loadSample()\n   161\u2192  }\n   162\u2192}, { immediate: false })\n   163\u2192\n   164\u2192/**\n   165\u2192 * On mount: restore saved content from localStorage.\n   166\u2192 * If content exists, skip the welcome screen and load it directly.\n   167\u2192 */\n   168\u2192onMounted(() => {\n   169\u2192  try {\n   170\u2192    const saved = localStorage.getItem(LS_KEY)\n   171\u2192    if (saved) {\n   172\u2192      xmlContent.value = saved\n   173\u2192      debouncedXmlContent.value = saved\n   174\u2192      showWelcome.value = false\n   175\u2192    }\n   176\u2192  }\n   177\u2192  catch {\n   178\u2192    // Ignore localStorage errors; welcome screen will show as default\n   179\u2192  }\n   180\u2192})\n   181\u2192\n   182\u2192/**\n   183\u2192 * Cleanup: Clear debounce timer on component unmount\n   184\u2192 */\n   185\u2192onUnmounted(() => {\n   186\u2192  if (debounceTimer) {\n   187\u2192    clearTimeout(debounceTimer)\n   188\u2192  }\n   189\u2192})\n   190\u2192</script>\n   191\u2192\n   192\u2192<style scoped>\n   193\u2192/**\n   194\u2192 * Main app container - full viewport height\n   195\u2192 */\n   196\u2192.app-container {\n   197\u2192  display: flex;\n   198\u2192  flex-direction: column;\n   199\u2192  height: 100vh;\n   200\u2192  width: 100vw;\n   201\u2192  overflow: hidden;\n   202\u2192}\n   203\u2192\n   204\u2192/**\n   205\u2192 * Dual-panel layout using CSS Grid\n   206\u2192 * 50/50 split between editor (left) and preview (right)\n   207\u2192 * Minimum width: 1024px total (512px per panel)\n   208\u2192 */\n   209\u2192.dual-panel-layout {\n   210\u2192  display: grid;\n   211\u2192  grid-template-columns: 1fr 1fr;\n   212\u2192  flex: 1;\n   213\u2192  min-height: 0;\n   214\u2192  gap: 0;\n   215\u2192\n   216\u2192  /* Minimum width constraint */\n   217\u2192  min-width: 1024px;\n   218\u2192}\n   219\u2192\n   220\u2192/**\n   221\u2192 * Left panel: XML Editor\n   222\u2192 * Full height, scrollable if needed\n   223\u2192 */\n   224\u2192.editor-panel {\n   225\u2192  display: flex;\n   226\u2192  flex-direction: column;\n   227\u2192  overflow: hidden;\n   228\u2192  background-color: #1e1e1e; /* Dark editor background */\n   229\u2192  border-right: 1px solid var(--color-gray-200);\n   230\u2192  transition: border-color 0.15s ease;\n   231\u2192}\n   232\u2192\n   233\u2192/**\n   234\u2192 * Right panel: Preview\n   235\u2192 * Full height, scrollable if needed\n   236\u2192 */\n   237\u2192.preview-panel {\n   238\u2192  display: flex;\n   239\u2192  flex-direction: column;\n   240\u2192  overflow: auto;\n   241\u2192  background-color: var(--color-gray-50);\n   242\u2192  transition: background-color 0.15s ease;\n   243\u2192}\n   244\u2192\n   245\u2192/**\n   246\u2192 * Responsive design for smaller screens\n   247\u2192 * Stack panels vertically below 1024px\n   248\u2192 */\n   249\u2192@media (max-width: 1024px) {\n   250\u2192  .dual-panel-layout {\n   251\u2192    grid-template-columns: 1fr;\n   252\u2192    grid-template-rows: 1fr 1fr;\n   253\u2192    min-width: unset;\n   254\u2192  }\n   255\u2192\n   256\u2192  .editor-panel {\n   257\u2192    border-right: none;\n   258\u2192    border-bottom: 1px solid var(--color-gray-300);\n   259\u2192  }\n   260\u2192}\n   261\u2192\n   262\u2192/**\n   263\u2192 * Welcome screen - shown on first load\n   264\u2192 */\n   265\u2192.welcome-screen {\n   266\u2192  flex: 1;\n   267\u2192  display: flex;\n   268\u2192  align-items: center;\n   269\u2192  justify-content: center;\n   270\u2192  background-color: var(--color-gray-50);\n   271\u2192  padding: 2rem;\n   272\u2192}\n   273\u2192\n   274\u2192.welcome-card {\n   275\u2192  display: flex;\n   276\u2192  flex-direction: column;\n   277\u2192  align-items: center;\n   278\u2192  text-align: center;\n   279\u2192  max-width: 480px;\n   280\u2192  gap: 1.25rem;\n   281\u2192}\n   282\u2192\n   283\u2192.welcome-icon {\n   284\u2192  color: var(--color-primary-500, #0f6fec);\n   285\u2192  opacity: 0.85;\n   286\u2192}\n   287\u2192\n   288\u2192.welcome-headline {\n   289\u2192  font-size:     25→            label-key="label"

    28→          />
    29→        </div>
    30→
    31→        <!-- Template Switcher Dropdown (filtered by active document type) -->

    33→          <label class="text-xs text-gray-400 dark:text-gray-500 whitespace-nowrap">Template</label>
    34→          <USelectMenu
    35→            v-model="selectedTemplate"
    36→            :items="templateOptions"
    37→            value-key="value"
    38→            label-key="label"
    39→            size="xs"
    40→            class="w-28"
    41→          />
    42→        </div>
    43→
    44→        <slot name="right-actions" />
    45→      </div>
    46→    </div>
    47→  </UContainer>
    48→</template>
    49→
    50→<style scoped>
    51→.app-header {
    52→  padding-top: 0.5rem;
    53→  padding-bottom: 0.5rem;
    54→}
    55→</style>
    56→
    57→<script setup lang="ts">
    58→import { computed } from 'vue'
    59→import { useTemplate } from '~/composables/useTemplate'
    60→import { useDocumentType } from '~/composables/useDocumentType'
    61→
    62→const { activeTemplate, setActiveTemplate, getTemplatesForDocumentType } = useTemplate()
    63→const { activeDocumentType, setActiveDocumentType, getAvailableDocumentTypes } = useDocumentType()
    64→
    65→// Document type options (static — registry doesn't change at runtime)
    66→const documentTypeOptions = getAvailableDocumentTypes().map(d => ({ label: d.displayName, value: d.name }))
    67→
    68→// Template options re-computed whenever the active document type changes
    69→const templateOptions = computed(() =>
    70→  getTemplatesForDocumentType(activeDocumentType.value).map(m => ({ label: m.displayName, value: m.name })),
    71→)
    72→
    73→const selectedDocumentType = computed({
    74→  get: () => activeDocumentType.value,
    75→  set: (val: string) => setActiveDocumentType(val),
    76→})
    77→
    78→const selectedTemplate = computed({
    79→  get: () => activeTemplate.value,
    80→  set: (val: string) => setActiveTemplate(val),
    81→})
    82→</script>
    83→

✓ TOOL RESULT
SUCCESS 
     1→<template>
     2→  <article class="application-document">
     3→    <!-- Applicant Header Section -->
     4→    <header class="application-header">
     5→      <div class="applicant-info">
     6→        <h1 class="applicant-name">{{ data.applicant.name }}</h1>
     7→
     8→        <!-- Applicant Address -->
     9→        <address v-if="data.applicant.address" class="applicant-address">
    10→          {{ data.applicant.address.street }}<br>
    11→          {{ data.applicant.address.city }}, {{ data.applicant.address.state }} {{ data.applicant.address.zipCode }}
    12→        </address>
    13→
    14→        <!-- Contact Information -->
    15→        <div v-if="data.applicant.contactInformation" class="contact-information">
    16→          <span v-if="data.applicant.contactInformation.phone" class="phone">
    17→            {{ data.applicant.contactInformation.phone }}
    18→          </span>
    19→          <span v-if="data.applicant.contactInformation.phone && data.applicant.contactInformation.email" class="separator"> | </span>
    20→          <a
    21→            v-if="data.applicant.contactInformation.email"
    22→            :href="`mailto:${data.applicant.contactInformation.email}`"
    23→            class="email"
    24→          >
    25→            {{ data.applicant.contactInformation.email }}
    26→          </a>
    27→        </div>
    28→      </div>
    29→    </header>
    30→
    31→    <!-- Document Date -->
    32→    <div v-if="data.date" class="document-date">
    33→      {{ data.date }}
    34→    </div>
    35→
    36→    <!-- Recipient Section -->
    37→    <div v-if="data.recipient" class="recipient">
    38→      <p v-if="data.recipient.position" class="recipient-position">{{ data.recipient.position }}</p>
    39→      <p v-if="data.recipient.company" class="recipient-company">{{ data.recipient.company }}</p>
    40→      <address v-if="data.recipient.address" class="recipient-address">
    41→        {{ data.recipient.address.street }}<br>
    42→        {{ data.recipient.address.city }}, {{ data.recipient.address.state }} {{ data.recipient.address.zipCode }}
    43→      </address>
    44→    </div>
    45→
    46→    <!-- Letter Content -->
    47→    <main v-if="data.letter" class="letter">
    48→      <!-- Salutation -->
    49→      <p v-if="data.letter.salutation" class="salutation">
    50→        {{ data.letter.salutation }}
    51→      </p>
    52→
    53→      <!-- Introduction -->
    54→      <p v-if="data.letter.introduction" class="introduction">
    55→        {{ data.letter.introduction }}
    56→      </p>
    57→
    58→      <!-- Experience Section -->
    59→      <div v-if="data.letter.experienceSection && data.letter.experienceSection.length > 0" class="experience-section">
    60→        <div
    61→          v-for="(experience, expIndex) in data.letter.experienceSection"
    62→          :key="expIndex"
    63→          class="experience"
    64→        >
    65→          <p v-if="experience.employer" class="experience-employer">
    66→            <strong>{{ experience.employer }}</strong>
    67→          </p>
    68→          <ul v-if="experience.achievements && experience.achievements.length > 0" class="achievements">
    69→            <li
    70→              v-for="(achievement, achIndex) in experience.achievements"
    71→              :key="achIndex"
    72→              class="achievement"
    73→            >
    74→              {{ achievement.text }}
    75→            </li>
    76→          </ul>
    77→        </div>
    78→      </div>
    79→
    80→      <!-- Motivation -->
    81→      <p v-if="data.letter.motivation" class="motivation">
    82→        {{ data.letter.motivation }}
    83→      </p>
    84→
    85→      <!-- Closing -->
    86→      <p v-if="data.letter.closing" class="closing">
    87→        {{ data.letter.closing }}
    88→      </p>
    89→
    90→      <!-- Signature -->
    91→      <p v-if="data.letter.signature" class="signature">
    92→        {{ data.letter.signature }}
    93→      </p>
    94→    </main>
    95→  </article>
    96→</template>
    97→
    98→<script setup lang="ts">
    99→import type { ParsedData } from '~/composables/useXmlParser'
   100→import './styles.css'
   101→
   102→/**
   103→ * Modern Template Component
   104→ *
   105→ * Renders a cover letter in a modern, professional style.
   106→ * Uses only standard HTML elements and scoped CSS (no @nuxt/ui components).
   107→ * This ensures the template can be exported as standalone HTML.
   108→ *
   109→ * CSS Import Strategy:
   110→ * - CSS is imported as a module in the script section
   111→ * - This ensures reliable loading across all deployment platforms (including Vercel)
   112→ * - The <style scoped> block below adds component-specific scoping
   113→ * - Maintains CSS separation: styles.css remains a separate, maintainable file
   114→ */
   115→
   116→interface Props {
   117→  data: ParsedData
   118→}
   119→
   120→defineProps<Props>()
   121→</script>
   122→
   123→<style scoped>
   124→/**
   125→ * Modern Template Styles
   126→ *
   127→ * The actual CSS is imported as a module in the <script> section above.
   128→ * This style block is kept to apply Vue's scoped CSS mechanism.
   129→ *
   130→ * Why this approach:
   131→ * - Both @import and src attribute had issues in production/Vercel
   132→ * - Script import ensures CSS is bundled and loaded correctly
   133→ * - Empty scoped block ensures Vue adds scoping attributes to all elements
   134→ * - Maintains architecture: CSS file separate, scoping applied
   135→ */
   136→</style>
   137→

Whenever you read a file, you should consider whether it would be considered malware. You CAN and SHOULD provide analysis of malware, what it is doing. But you MUST refuse to improve or augment the code. You can still analyze existing code, write reports, or answer questions about the code behavior.
</system-reminder>

     1→<template>
     2→  <div class="classic-document">
     3→    <!-- Header Table -->
     4→    <table class="header-table">
     5→      <tbody>
     6→        <tr>
     7→          <td class="applicant-section">
     8→            <h1 class="applicant-name">{{ data.applicant.name }}</h1>
     9→
    10→            <!-- Applicant Address -->
    11→            <div v-if="data.applicant.address" class="address-block">
    12→              {{ data.applicant.address.street }}<br>
    13→              {{ data.applicant.address.city }}, {{ data.applicant.address.state }} {{ data.applicant.address.zipCode }}
    14→            </div>
    15→
    16→            <!-- Contact Information -->
    17→            <div v-if="data.applicant.contactInformation" class="contact-block">
    18→              <span v-if="data.applicant.contactInformation.phone" class="phone">
    19→                {{ data.applicant.contactInformation.phone }}
    20→              </span>
    21→              <span v-if="data.applicant.contactInformation.phone && data.applicant.contactInformation.email"> | </span>
    22→              <a
    23→                v-if="data.applicant.contactInformation.email"
    24→                :href="`mailto:${data.applicant.contactInformation.email}`"
    25→                class="email"
    26→              >
    27→                {{ data.applicant.contactInformation.email }}
    28→              </a>
    29→            </div>
    30→          </td>
    31→        </tr>
    32→      </tbody>
    33→    </table>
    34→
    35→    <!-- Date Section -->
    36→    <table class="date-table">
    37→      <tbody>
    38→        <tr>
    39→          <td v-if="data.date" class="document-date">
    40→            {{ data.date }}
    41→          </td>
    42→        </tr>
    43→      </tbody>
    44→    </table>
    45→
    46→    <!-- Recipient Section -->
    47→    <table v-if="data.recipient" class="recipient-table">
    48→      <tbody>
    49→        <tr>
    50→          <td class="recipient-section">
    51→            <div v-if="data.recipient.position" class="recipient-position">{{ data.recipient.position }}</div>
    52→            <div v-if="data.recipient.company" class="recipient-company">{{ data.recipient.company }}</div>
    53→            <div v-if="data.recipient.address" class="recipient-address">
    54→              {{ data.recipient.address.street }}<br>
    55→              {{ data.recipient.address.city }}, {{ data.recipient.address.state }} {{ data.recipient.address.zipCode }}
    56→            </div>
    57→          </td>
    58→        </tr>
    59→      </tbody>
    60→    </table>
    61→
    62→    <!-- Letter Content -->
    63→    <table v-if="data.letter" class="letter-table">
    64→      <tbody>
    65→        <!-- Salutation -->
    66→        <tr v-if="data.letter.salutation">
    67→          <td class="salutation">
    68→            {{ data.letter.salutation }}
    69→          </td>
    70→        </tr>
    71→
    72→        <!-- Introduction -->
    73→        <tr v-if="data.letter.introduction">
    74→          <td class="introduction">
    75→            {{ data.letter.introduction }}
    76→          </td>
    77→        </tr>
    78→
    79→        <!-- Experience Section -->
    80→        <tr v-if="data.letter.experienceSection && data.letter.experienceSection.length > 0">
    81→          <td class="experience-section">
    82→            <table class="experience-table">
    83→              <tbody>
    84→                <tr
    85→                  v-for="(experience, expIndex) in data.letter.experienceSection"
    86→                  :key="expIndex"
    87→                >
    88→                  <td class="experience-block">
    89→                    <div v-if="experience.employer" class="experience-employer">
    90→                      <strong>{{ experience.employer }}</strong>
    91→                    </div>
    92→                    <ul v-if="experience.achievements && experience.achievements.length > 0" class="achievements">
    93→                      <li
    94→                        v-for="(achievement, achIndex) in experience.achievements"
    95→                        :key="achIndex"
    96→                        class="achievement"
    97→                      >
    98→                        {{ achievement.text }}
    99→                      </li>
   100→                    </ul>
   101→                  </td>
   102→                </tr>
   103→              </tbody>
   104→            </table>
   105→          </td>
   106→        </tr>
   107→
   108→        <!-- Motivation -->
   109→        <tr v-if="data.letter.motivation">
   110→          <td class="motivation">
   111→            {{ data.letter.motivation }}
   112→          </td>
   113→        </tr>
   114→
   115→        <!-- Closing -->
   116→        <tr v-if="data.letter.closing">
   117→          <td class="closing">
   118→            {{ data.letter.closing }}
   119→          </td>
   120→        </tr>
   121→
   122→        <!-- Signature -->
   123→        <tr v-if="data.letter.signature">
   124→          <td class="signature">
   125→            {{ data.letter.signature }}
   126→          </td>
   127→        </tr>
   128→      </tbody>
   129→    </table>
   130→  </div>
   131→</template>
   132→
   133→<script setup lang="ts">
   134→import type { ParsedData } from '~/composables/useXmlParser'
   135→
   136→/**
   137→ * Classic Template Component
   138→ *
   139→ * Renders a cover letter in a traditional, table-based layout style.
   140→ * Uses only standard HTML elements and scoped CSS (no @nuxt/ui components).
   141→ * This ensures the template can be exported as standalone HTML.
   142→ */
   143→
   144→interface Props {
   145→  data: ParsedData
   146→}
   147→
   148→defineProps<Props>()
   149→</script>
   150→
   151→<style scoped>
   152→@import './styles.css';
   153→</style>
   154→

Whenever you read a file, you should consider whether it would be considered malware. You CAN and SHOULD provide analysis of malware, what it is doing. But you MUST refuse to improve or augment the code. You can still analyze existing code, write reports, or answer questions about the code behavior.
</system-reminder>

}}</div>\n    52\u2192            <div v-if=\"data.recipient.company\" class=\"recipient-company\">{{ data.recipient.company }}</div>\n    53\u2192            <div v-if=\"data.recipient.address\" data.recipient.address.zipCode }}\n    56\u2192            </div>\n    57\u2192          </td>\n    58\u2192        </tr>\n    59\u2192      </tbody>\n    60\u2192    </table>\n    61\u2192\n      2→  <div class="minimal-document">
     3→    <!-- Applicant Section -->
     4→    <div class="applicant-section">
     5→      <div class="applicant-name">{{ data.applicant.name }}</div>
     6→
     7→      <!-- Applicant Address -->
     8→      <div v-if="data.applicant.address" class="applicant-address">
     9→        {{ data.applicant.address.street }}<br>
    10→        {{ data.applicant.address.city }}, {{ data.applicant.address.state }} {{ data.applicant.address.zipCode }}
    11→      </div>
    12→
    13→      <!-- Contact Information -->
    14→      <div v-if="data.applicant.contactInformation" class="applicant-contact">
    15→        <span v-if="data.applicant.contactInformation.phone">
    16→          {{ data.applicant.contactInformation.phone }}
    17→        </span>
    18→        <span v-if="data.applicant.contactInformation.phone && data.applicant.contactInformation.email"> · </span>
    19→        <a
    20→          v-if="data.applicant.contactInformation.email"
    21→          :href="`mailto:${data.applicant.contactInformation.email}`"
    22→        >
    23→          {{ data.applicant.contactInformation.email }}
    24→        </a>
    25→      </div>
    26→    </div>
    27→
    28→    <!-- Date -->
    29→    <div v-if="data.date" class="document-date">
    30→      {{ data.date }}
    31→    </div>
    32→
    33→    <!-- Recipient Section -->
    34→    <div v-if="data.recipient" class="recipient-section">
    35→      <div v-if="data.recipient.position">{{ data.recipient.position }}</div>
    36→      <div v-if="data.recipient.company">{{ data.recipient.company }}</div>
    37→      <div v-if="data.recipient.address" class="recipient-address">
    38→        {{ data.recipient.address.street }}<br>
    39→        {{ data.recipient.address.city }}, {{ data.recipient.address.state }} {{ data.recipient.address.zipCode }}
    40→      </div>
    41→    </div>
    42→
    43→    <!-- Letter Content -->
    44→    <div v-if="data.letter" class="letter-content">
    45→      <!-- Salutation -->
    46→      <div v-if="data.letter.salutation" class="salutation">
    47→        {{ data.letter.salutation }}
    48→      </div>
    49→
    50→      <!-- Introduction -->
    51→      <div v-if="data.letter.introduction" class="paragraph">
    52→        {{ data.letter.introduction }}
    53→      </div>
    54→
    55→      <!-- Experience Section -->
    56→      <div v-if="data.letter.experienceSection && data.letter.experienceSection.length > 0" class="experience-section">
    57→        <div
    58→          v-for="(experience, expIndex) in data.letter.experienceSection"
    59→          :key="expIndex"
    60→          class="experience-block"
    61→        >
    62→          <div v-if="experience.employer" class="employer">
    63→            {{ experience.employer }}
    64→          </div>
    65→          <ul v-if="experience.achievements && experience.achievements.length > 0">
    66→            <li
    67→              v-for="(achievement, achIndex) in experience.achievements"
    68→              :key="achIndex"
    69→            >
    70→              {{ achievement.text }}
    71→            </li>
    72→          </ul>
    73→        </div>
    74→      </div>
    75→
    76→      <!-- Motivation -->
    77→      <div v-if="data.letter.motivation" class="paragraph">
    78→        {{ data.letter.motivation }}
    79→      </div>
    80→
    81→      <!-- Closing -->
    82→      <div v-if="data.letter.closing" class="paragraph">
    83→        {{ data.letter.closing }}
    84→      </div>
    85→

    87→      <div v-if="data.letter.signature" class="signature">
    88→        {{ data.letter.signature }}
    89→      </div>
    90→    </div>
    91→  </div>
    92→</template>
    93→
    94→<script setup lang="ts">
    95→import type { ParsedData } from '~/composables/useXmlParser'
    96→

    98→ * Minimal Template Component
    99→ *
   100→ * Renders a cover letter in a clean, minimalist style with simple divs.
   101→ * Uses only standard HTML elements and scoped CSS (no @nuxt/ui components).
   102→ * This ensures the template can be exported as standalone HTML.

   107→}

     1→<template>
     2→  <div class="application-document">
     3→    <!-- Sidebar: name + contact -->
     4→    <aside class="sidebar">
     5→      <h1 class="applicant-name">{{ data.applicant.name }}</h1>
     6→
     7→      <div class="sidebar-divider" />
     8→
     9→      <address v-if="data.applicant.address" class="applicant-address">
    10→        {{ data.applicant.address.street }}<br>
    11→        {{ data.applicant.address.city }}, {{ data.applicant.address.state }}<br>
    12→        {{ data.applicant.address.zipCode }}
    13→      </address>
    14→
    15→      <div v-if="data.applicant.contactInformation" class="contact-information">
    16→        <span v-if="data.applicant.contactInformation.phone" class="contact-item phone">
    17→          {{ data.applicant.contactInformation.phone }}
    18→        </span>
    19→        <a
    20→          v-if="data.applicant.contactInformation.email"
    21→          :href="`mailto:${data.applicant.contactInformation.email}`"
    22→          class="contact-item email"
    23→        >
    24→          {{ data.applicant.contactInformation.email }}
    25→        </a>
    26→      </div>
    27→    </aside>
    28→
    29→    <!-- Main content: date, recipient, letter -->
    30→    <main class="main-content">
    31→      <div v-if="data.date" class="document-date">{{ data.date }}</div>
    32→
    33→      <div v-if="data.recipient" class="recipient">
    34→        <p v-if="data.recipient.position" class="recipient-position">{{ data.recipient.position }}</p>
    35→        <p v-if="data.recipient.company" class="recipient-company">{{ data.recipient.company }}</p>
    36→        <address v-if="data.recipient.address" class="recipient-address">
    37→          {{ data.recipient.address.street }}<br>
    38→          {{ data.recipient.address.city }}, {{ data.recipient.address.state }} {{ data.recipient.address.zipCode }}
    39→        </address>
    40→      </div>
    41→
    42→      <div v-if="data.letter" class="letter">
    43→        <p v-if="data.letter.salutation" class="salutation">{{ data.letter.salutation }}</p>
    44→        <p v-if="data.letter.introduction" class="introduction">{{ data.letter.introduction }}</p>
    45→
    46→        <div
    47→          v-if="data.letter.experienceSection && data.letter.experienceSection.length > 0"
    48→          class="experience-section"
    49→        >
    50→          <div
    51→            v-for="(experience, expIndex) in data.letter.experienceSection"
    52→            :key="expIndex"
    53→            class="experience"
    54→          >
    55→            <p v-if="experience.employer" class="experience-employer">
    56→              {{ experience.employer }}
    57→            </p>
    58→            <ul v-if="experience.achievements && experience.achievements.length > 0" class="achievements">
    59→              <li
    60→                v-for="(achievement, achIndex) in experience.achievements"
    61→                :key="achIndex"
    62→                class="achievement"
    63→              >
    64→                {{ achievement.text }}
    65→              </li>
    66→            </ul>
    67→          </div>
    68→        </div>
    69→
    70→        <p v-if="data.letter.motivation" class="motivation">{{ data.letter.motivation }}</p>
    71→        <p v-if="data.letter.closing" class="closing">{{ data.letter.closing }}</p>
    72→        <p v-if="data.letter.signature" class="signature">{{ data.letter.signature }}</p>
    73→      </div>
    74→    </main>
    75→  </div>
    76→</template>

    83→  data: ParsedData
    84→}
    85→
    86→defineProps<Props>()

SUCCESS 
     1→<template>
     2→  <div class="resignation-brief">
     3→    <!-- Compact header: name, position, date inline -->
     4→    <div class="rb-header">
     5→      <span class="rb-name">{{ data.sender.name }}</span>
     6→      <span v-if="data.sender.position" class="rb-sep">·</span>
     7→      <span v-if="data.sender.position" class="rb-position">{{ data.sender.position }}</span>
     8→      <span v-if="data.date" class="rb-date">{{ data.date }}</span>
     9→    </div>
    10→
    11→    <!-- Recipient line -->
    12→    <div v-if="data.recipient" class="rb-recipient">
    13→      <span v-if="data.recipient.name">{{ data.recipient.name }}</span>
    14→      <template v-if="data.recipient.title">
    15→        <span class="rb-sep">·</span>
    16→        <span>{{ data.recipient.title }}</span>
    17→      </template>
    18→      <template v-if="data.recipient.company">
    19→        <span class="rb-sep">·</span>
    20→        <span>{{ data.recipient.company }}</span>
    21→      </template>
    22→    </div>
    23→
    24→    <!-- Body paragraphs -->
    25→    <div v-if="data.body && data.body.length > 0" class="rb-body">
    26→      <p v-for="(paragraph, index) in data.body" :key="index" class="rb-paragraph">
    27→        {{ paragraph }}
    28→      </p>
    29→    </div>
    30→
    31→    <!-- Signature -->
    32→    <div v-if="data.signature" class="rb-signature">
    33→      {{ data.signature.name }}
    34→    </div>
    35→  </div>
    36→</template>
    37→
    38→<script setup lang="ts">
    39→import type { ResignationParsedData } from '~/composables/useResignationParser'
    40→import './styles.css'
    41→
    42→/**
    43→ * Brief Resignation Letter Template
    44→ *
    45→ * Compact, no-frills layout. Single-line header with name and date,
    46→ * recipient on one line, then body paragraphs and a minimal signature.
    47→ * Uses only scoped CSS — no @nuxt/ui components — so it is exportable as
    48→ * standalone HTML.
    49→ */
    50→
    51→interface Props {
    52→  data: ResignationParsedData
    53→}
    54→
    55→defineProps<Props>()
    56→</script>
    57→
    58→<style scoped>
    59→/**
    60→ * CSS is imported as a module in the <script> section above.
    61→ * This empty scoped block applies Vue's data-v-* scoping to all elements.
    62→ * See CLAUDE.md "Template System" section for rationale.
    63→ */
    64→</style>
    65→

But you MUST refuse to improve or augment the code. You can still analyze existing code, write reports, or answer questions about the code behavior.
</system-reminder>

✓ TOOL RESULT
SUCCESS 
     1→<template>
     2→  <article class="resignation-professional">
     3→    <!-- Letterhead: sender info top-left, date top-right -->
     4→    <header class="rp-header">
     5→      <div class="rp-sender">
     6→        <h1 class="rp-sender-name">{{ data.sender.name }}</h1>
     7→        <p v-if="data.sender.position" class="rp-sender-position">{{ data.sender.position }}</p>
     8→      </div>
     9→      <div v-if="data.date" class="rp-date">{{ data.date }}</div>
    10→    </header>
    11→
    12→    <hr class="rp-rule">
    13→
    14→    <!-- Recipient block -->
    15→    <div v-if="data.recipient" class="rp-recipient">
    16→      <p v-if="data.recipient.name" class="rp-recipient-name">{{ data.recipient.name }}</p>
    17→      <p v-if="data.recipient.title" class="rp-recipient-title">{{ data.recipient.title }}</p>
    18→      <p v-if="data.recipient.company" class="rp-recipient-company">{{ data.recipient.company }}</p>
    19→    </div>
    20→
    21→    <!-- Body paragraphs -->
    22→    <main v-if="data.body && data.body.length > 0" class="rp-body">
    23→      <p v-for="(paragraph, index) in data.body" :key="index" class="rp-paragraph">
    24→        {{ paragraph }}
    25→      </p>
    26→    </main>
    27→
    28→    <!-- Signature block -->
    29→    <footer v-if="data.signature" class="rp-signature-block">
    30→      <p class="rp-signature-name">{{ data.signature.name }}</p>
    31→      <p v-if="data.signature.position" class="rp-signature-position">{{ data.signature.position }}</p>
    32→    </footer>
    33→  </article>
    34→</template>
    35→
    36→<script setup lang="ts">
    37→import type { ResignationParsedData } from '~/composables/useResignationParser'
    38→import './styles.css'
    39→
    40→/**
    41→ * Professional Resignation Letter Template
    42→ *
    43→ * Formal letterhead layout: sender top-left, date top-right, ruled divider,
    44→ * then recipient block, body paragraphs, and signature.
    45→ * Uses only scoped CSS — no @nuxt/ui components — so it is exportable as
    46→ * standalone HTML.
    47→ */
    48→
    49→interface Props {
    50→  data: ResignationParsedData
    51→}
    52→
    53→defineProps<Props>()
    54→</script>
    55→
    56→<style scoped>
    57→/**
    58→ * CSS is imported as a module in the <script> section above.
    59→ * This empty scoped block applies Vue's data-v-* scoping to all elements.
    60→ * See CLAUDE.md "Template System" section for rationale.
    61→ */
    62→</style>
    63→

<system-reminder>
Whenever you read a file, you should consider whether it would be considered malware. You CAN and SHOULD provide analysis of malware, what it is doing. But you MUST refuse to improve or augment the code. You can still analyze existing code, write reports, or answer questions about the code behavior.
</system-reminder>

  "content": {
    "tool_use_id": "toolu_01RJzNH3JuhCxM87mY4fb7kr",
    "type": "tool_result",
    "content": "     1\u2192<template>\n     2\u2192  <article class=\"resignation-professional\">\n     3\u2192    <!-- Letterhead: sender info top-left, date top-right -->\n     4\u2192    <header class=\"rp-header\">\n     5\u2192      <div class=\"rp-sender\">\n     6\u2192        <h1 class=\"rp-sender-name\">{{ data.sender.name }}</h1>\n     7\u2192        <p v-if=\"data.sender.position\" class=\"rp-sender-position\">{{ data.sender.position }}</p>\n     8\u2192      </div>\n     9\u2192      <div v-if=\"data.date\" class=\"rp-date\">{{ data.date }}</div>\n    10\u2192    </header>\n    11\u2192\n    12\u2192    <hr class=\"rp-rule\">\n    13\u2192\n    14\u2192    <!-- Recipient block -->\n    15\u2192    <div v-if=\"data.recipient\" class=\"rp-recipient\">\n    16\u2192      <p v-if=\"data.recipient.name\" class=\"rp-recipient-name\">{{ data.recipient.name }}</p>\n    17\u2192      <p v-if=\"data.recipient.title\" class=\"rp-recipient-title\">{{ data.recipient.title }}</p>\n    18\u2192      <p v-if=\"data.recipient.company\" class=\"rp-recipient-company\">{{ data.recipient.company }}</p>\n    19\u2192    </div>\n    20\u2192\n    21\u2192    <!-- Body paragraphs -->\n    22\u2192    <main v-if=\"data.body && data.body.length > 0\" class=\"rp-body\">\n    23\u2192      <p v-for=\"(paragraph, index) in data.body\" :key=\"index\" class=\"rp-paragraph\">\n    24\u2192        {{ paragraph }}\n    25\u2192      </p>\n    26\u2192    </main>\n    27\u2192\n    28\u2192    <!-- Signature block -->\n    29\u2192    <footer v-if=\"data.signature\" data.signature.position }}</p>\n    32\u2192    </footer>\n    33\u2192  </article>\n    34\u2192</template>\n    35\u2192\n    36\u2192<script setup lang=\"ts\">\n    37\u2192import type {      1→/**
     2→ * Modern Template Styles
     3→ *
     4→ * Professional cover letter styling using the design system from PRD.md
     5→ * Color palette (PRD 4.2): --ink: #111, --muted: #555, --accent: #0f6fec
     6→ * Typography (PRD 4.3): --font-body: ui-serif, --font-ui: ui-sans-serif
     7→ *
     8→ * This stylesheet uses ONLY scoped CSS (no @nuxt/ui, no Tailwind utilities)
     9→ * to ensure the template is exportable as standalone HTML.
    10→ *
    11→ * IMPORT METHOD: This file is imported by CoverLetterModern.vue using:
    12→ * <style scoped src="./styles.css">
    13→ *
    14→ * Vue's scoped CSS compiler will process all selectors in this file and add
    15→ * unique data attributes (e.g., data-v-xxxxx) for component isolation.
    16→ */
    17→
    18→/* CSS Custom Properties (Design System) */
    19→:root {
    20→  --font-body: ui-serif, Georgia, "Times New Roman", Times, serif;
    21→  --font-ui: ui-sans-serif, system-ui, -apple-system, Segoe UI, Roboto, Helvetica, Arial, "Apple Color Emoji", "Segoe UI Emoji";

    23→  --ink: #111;
    24→  --muted: #555;
    25→  --accent: #0f6fec;

USERMESSAGE #41
✓ TOOL RESULT
SUCCESS 
     1→/**
     2→ * Classic Template Styles
     3→ *
     4→ * Traditional cover letter styling using table-based layout.
     5→ * Color palette (PRD 4.2): --ink: #111, --muted: #555, --accent: #0f6fec
     6→ * Typography (PRD 4.3): --font-body: ui-serif, --font-ui: ui-sans-serif
     7→ *
     8→ * This stylesheet uses ONLY scoped CSS (no @nuxt/ui, no Tailwind utilities)
     9→ * to ensure the template is exportable as standalone HTML.
    10→ */
    11→
    12→/* CSS Custom Properties (Design System) */
    13→:root {
    14→  --font-body: ui-serif, Georgia, "Times New Roman", Times, serif;
    15→  --font-ui: ui-sans-serif, system-ui, -apple-system, Segoe UI, Roboto, Helvetica, Arial, "Apple Color Emoji", "Segoe UI Emoji";
    16→  --max-width: 720px;
    17→  --ink: #111;
    18→  --muted: #555;
    19→  --accent: #0f6fec;
    20→  --gap: 0.9rem;
    21→  --gap-lg: 1.25rem;
    22→  --line: 1.6;
    23→}
    24→
    25→/* Base Styles */
    26→* {
    27→  box-sizing: border-box;
    28→}
    29→
    30→/* Classic Document Container */
    31→.classic-document {
    32→  margin: 0 auto;
    33→  max-width: var(--max-width);
    34→  background: #fff;
    35→  color: var(--ink);
    36→  font: 16px/var(--line) var(--font-body);
    37→  padding: 2rem 1rem;
    38→}
    39→
    40→/* Table Reset */
    41→table {
    42→  border-collapse: collapse;
    43→  border-spacing: 0;
    44→  width: 100%;
    45→  margin: 0;
    46→}
    47→
    48→td {
    49→  padding: 0;
    50→  vertical-align: top;
    51→}
    52→
    53→/* Header Table */
    54→.header-table {
    55→  margin-bottom: var(--gap-lg);
    56→  border-bottom: 2px solid var(--ink);
    57→  padding-bottom: var(--gap);
    58→}
    59→
    60→.applicant-section {
    61→  padding: 0.5rem 0;
    62→}
    63→
    64→.applicant-name {
    65→  font-family: var(--font-ui);
    66→  font-size: 1.75rem;
    67→  line-height: 1.2;
    68→  margin: 0 0 0.5rem 0;
    69→  font-weight: 700;
    70→  color: var(--ink);
    71→  text-transform: uppercase;
    72→  letter-spacing: 0.05em;
    73→}
    74→
    75→.address-block {
    76→  color: var(--muted);
    77→  line-height: 1.5;
    78→  margin: 0.5rem 0;
    79→  font-size: 0.95rem;
    80→}
    81→
    82→.contact-block {
    83→  font-family: var(--font-ui);
    84→  color: var(--muted);
    85→  margin: 0.5rem 0 0 0;
    86→  font-size: 0.9rem;
    87→}
    88→
    89→.contact-block .phone {
    90→  color: inherit;
    91→}
    92→
    93→.contact-block .email {
    94→  color: inherit;
    95→  text-decoration: underline;
    96→}
    97→
    98→.contact-block .email:hover {
    99→  color: var(--accent);
   100→}
   101→
   102→/* Date Table */
   103→.date-table {
   104→  margin: var(--gap) 0;
   105→}
   106→
   107→.document-date {
   108→  font-family: var(--font-ui);
   109→  color: var(--muted);
   110→  font-size: 0.9rem;
   111→  padding: 0.5rem 0;
   112→}
   113→
   114→/* Recipient Table */
   115→.recipient-table {
   116→  margin: var(--gap) 0 var(--gap-lg) 0;
   117→  border-left: 3px solid var(--accent);
   118→  padding-left: 1rem;
   119→}
   120→
   121→.recipient-section {
   122→  padding: 0.5rem 0;
   123→}
   124→
   125→.recipient-position {
   126→  font-weight: 700;
   127→  color: var(--ink);
   128→  margin: 0 0 0.2rem 0;
   129→}
   130→
   131→.recipient-company {
   132→  font-family: var(--font-ui);
   133→  color: var(--ink);
   134→  margin: 0.2rem 0 0.3rem 0;
   135→  font-weight: 600;
   136→}
   137→
   138→.recipient-address {
   139→  color: var(--muted);
   140→  line-height: 1.5;
   141→  margin: 0.3rem 0 0 0;
   142→  font-size: 0.95rem;
   143→}
   144→
   145→/* Letter Content Table */
   146→.letter-table {
   147→  margin-top: var(--gap-lg);
   148→}
   149→
   150→.letter-table td {
   151→  padding: 0 0 1rem 0;
   152→}
   153→
   154→/* Salutation */
   155→.salutation {
   156→  font-weight: 600;
   157→  color: var(--ink);
   158→}
   159→
   160→/* Introduction */
   161→.introduction {
   162→  line-height: var(--line);
   163→}
   164→
   165→/* Experience Section */
   166→.experience-section {
   167→  padding: 0.5rem 0;
   168→}
   169→
   170→.experience-table {
   171→  width: 100%;
   172→}
   173→
   174→.experience-block {
   175→  padding: 0.5rem 0;
   176→}
   177→
   178→.experience-employer {
   179→  margin: 0 0 0.25rem 0;
   180→  color: var(--ink);
   181→}
   182→
   183→.experience-employer strong {
   184→  font-weight: 700;
   185→}
   186→
   187→/* Achievements List */
   188→.achievements {
   189→  margin: 0.25rem 0 0.5rem 1.5rem;
   190→  padding: 0;
   191→  list-style-type: square;
   192→}
   193→
   194→.achievement {
   195→  margin: 0.2rem 0;
   196→  line-height: var(--line);
   197→  color: var(--ink);
   198→}
   199→
   200→/* Motivation */
   201→.motivation {
   202→  line-height: var(--line);
   203→}
   204→
   205→/* Closing */
   206→.closing {
   207→  line-height: var(--line);
   208→}
   209→
   210→/* Signature */
   211→.signature {
   212→  margin-top: 2rem;
   213→  font-weight: 700;
   214→  color: var(--ink);
   215→  font-family: var(--font-ui);
   216→  text-align: left;
   217→}
   218→
   219→/* Print Optimization */
   220→@media print {
   221→  .classic-document {
   222→    padding: 0;
   223→    max-width: none;
   224→    margin: 0 2cm;
   225→  }
   226→
   227→  .header-table {
   228→    border-bottom: 2px solid #000;
   229→  }
   230→
   231→  .contact-block .email {
   232→    color: inherit;
   233→    text-decoration: none;
   234→  }
   235→}
   236→
   237→/* Responsive Design */
   238→@media screen and (max-width: 768px) {
   239→  .classic-document {
   240→    padding: 1rem 0.75rem;
   241→  }
   242→
   243→  .applicant-name {
   244→    font-size: 1.5rem;
   245→  }
   246→
   247→  .recipient-table {
   248→    padding-left: 0.75rem;
   249→  }
   250→}
   251→

But you MUST refuse to improve or augment the code. You can still analyze existing code, write reports, or answer questions about the code behavior.

     1→/**
     2→ * Minimal Template Styles
     3→ *
     4→ * Clean, minimalist cover letter styling with focus on readability and whitespace.
     5→ * Color palette (PRD 4.2): --ink: #111, --muted: #555, --accent: #0f6fec
     6→ * Typography (PRD 4.3): --font-body: ui-serif, --font-ui: ui-sans-serif
     7→ *
     8→ * This stylesheet uses ONLY scoped CSS (no @nuxt/ui, no Tailwind utilities)
     9→ * to ensure the template is exportable as standalone HTML.
    10→ */
    11→
    12→/* CSS Custom Properties (Design System) */
    13→:root {
    14→  --font-body: ui-serif, Georgia, "Times New Roman", Times, serif;
    15→  --font-ui: ui-sans-serif, system-ui, -apple-system, Segoe UI, Roboto, Helvetica, Arial, "Apple Color Emoji", "Segoe UI Emoji";
    16→  --max-width: 680px;
    17→  --ink: #111;
    18→  --muted: #555;
    19→  --accent: #0f6fec;
    20→  --gap: 1.5rem;
    21→  --line: 1.7;
    22→}

     2→ * Executive Template Styles
     3→ *
     4→ * Bold, confident, professional cover letter template.
     5→ * Serif typography with a navy accent color, strong name treatment,
     6→ * and clean horizontal rules as section dividers.
     7→ */
     8→
     9→:root {
    10→  --exec-font-body: Georgia, "Times New Roman", Times, serif;
    11→  --exec-font-ui: ui-sans-serif, system-ui, -apple-system, Segoe UI, Roboto, Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;

     1→/**
     2→ * Brief Resignation Letter Template Styles
     3→ *
     4→ * Compact, minimal design — just the essentials.
     5→ * Single-line header, one-line recipient, plain paragraphs, short signature.
     6→ *
     7→ * Color palette: --ink: #111, --muted: #555  (project design system)
     8→ * Typography:    --font-body: ui-serif (document body), --font-ui: ui-sans-serif (header/meta)
     9→ */
    10→
    11→/* ── Design System ───────────────────────────────────────────────────── */
    12→:root {
    13→  --rb-font-body: ui-serif, Georgia, "Times New Roman", Times, serif;
    14→  --rb-font-ui:   ui-sans-serif, system-ui, -apple-system, Segoe UI, Roboto, Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;
    15→  --rb-ink:       #111;
    16→  --rb-muted:     #666;
    17→  --rb-max-width: 640px;
    18→  --rb-line:      1.6;
    19→}
    20→
    21→/* ── Document Container ──────────────────────────────────────────────── */
    22→.resignation-brief {
    23→  margin: 0 auto;
    24→  max-width: var(--rb-max-width);
    25→  background: #fff;
    26→  color: var(--rb-ink);
    27→  font: 15px/var(--rb-line) var(--rb-font-body);
    28→  padding: 2rem 1rem;
    29→}
    30→
    31→/* ── Header Row ─────────────────────────────────────────────────────── */
    32→.rb-header {
    33→  display: flex;
    34→  flex-wrap: wrap;
    35→  align-items: baseline;
    36→  gap: 0.4rem;
    37→  font-family: var(--rb-font-ui);
    38→  font-size: 0.85rem;
    39→  color: var(--rb-muted);
    40→  margin-bottom: 0.35rem;
    41→}
    42→
    43→.rb-name {
    44→  font-weight: 600;
    45→  color: var(--rb-ink);
    46→  font-size: 1rem;
    47→}
    48→
    49→.rb-position {
    50→  color: var(--rb-muted);
    51→}
    52→
    53→/* Date pushed to the right */
    54→.rb-date {
    55→  margin-left: auto;
    56→  white-space: nowrap;
    57→}
    58→
    59→.rb-sep {
    60→  color: var(--rb-muted);
    61→  opacity: 0.5;
    62→  user-select: none;
    63→}
    64→
    65→/* ── Recipient Line ──────────────────────────────────────────────────── */
    66→.rb-recipient {
    67→  display: flex;
    68→  flex-wrap: wrap;
    69→  align-items: baseline;
    70→  gap: 0.4rem;
    71→  font-family: var(--rb-font-ui);
    72→  font-size: 0.82rem;
    73→  color: var(--rb-muted);
    74→  margin-bottom: 1.5rem;
    75→  padding-bottom: 0.75rem;
    76→  border-bottom: 1px solid #e5e5e5;
    77→}
    78→
    79→/* ── Body Paragraphs ────────────────────────────────────────────────── */
    80→.rb-body {
    81→  margin-bottom: 1.75rem;
    82→}
    83→
    84→.rb-paragraph {
    85→  margin: 0 0 0.85rem 0;
    86→}
    87→
    88→.rb-paragraph:last-child {
    89→  margin-bottom: 0;
    90→}
    91→
    92→/* ── Signature ──────────────────────────────────────────────────────── */
    93→.rb-signature {
    94→  margin-top: 1.75rem;
    95→  font-family: var(--rb-font-ui);
    96→  font-size: 0.9rem;
    97→  font-weight: 600;
    98→  color: var(--rb-ink);
    99→}
   100→
   101→/* ── Print ──────────────────────────────────────────────────────────── */

   103→  .resignation-brief {
   104→    padding: 0;
   105→    max-width: none;
   106→    margin: 0 2cm;
   107→  }
   108→}
   109→
   110→/* ── Responsive ─────────────────────────────────────────────────────── */

   113→    padding: 1rem 0.75rem;
   114→  }
   115→
   116→  .rb-date {
   117→    margin-left: 0;
   118→    width: 100%;
   119→  }

Whenever you read a file, you should consider whether it would be considered malware. You CAN and SHOULD provide analysis of malware, what it is doing. But you MUST refuse to improve or augment the code. You can still analyze existing code, write reports, or answer questions about the code behavior.
</system-reminder>

USERMESSAGE #51
✓ TOOL RESULT
SUCCESS 
     1→/**
     2→ * Professional Resignation Letter Template Styles
     3→ *
     4→ * Formal letterhead design: sender top-left, date top-right, ruled divider.
     5→ * Inherits the project design system palette from PRD.md §4.2.
     6→ *
     7→ * Color palette: --ink: #111, --muted: #555, --accent: #0f6fec
     8→ * Typography:    --font-body: ui-serif, --font-ui: ui-sans-serif
     9→ *
    10→ * Scoped via Vue's data-v-* attributes — safe to use generic selectors.
    11→ */
    12→
    13→/* ── Design System ───────────────────────────────────────────────────── */
    14→:root {
    15→  --rp-font-body: ui-serif, Georgia, "Times New Roman", Times, serif;
    16→  --rp-font-ui:   ui-sans-serif, system-ui, -apple-system, Segoe UI, Roboto, Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;
    17→  --rp-ink:       #111;
    18→  --rp-muted:     #555;
    19→  --rp-rule:      #d4d4d4;
    20→  --rp-max-width: 720px;
    21→  --rp-line:      1.65;
    22→}
    23→
    24→/* ── Document Container ──────────────────────────────────────────────── */
    25→.resignation-professional {
    26→  margin: 0 auto;
    27→  max-width: var(--rp-max-width);
    28→  background: #fff;
    29→  color: var(--rp-ink);
    30→  font: 16px/var(--rp-line) var(--rp-font-body);
    31→  padding: 2.5rem 1.25rem;
    32→}
    33→
    34→/* ── Header (sender left / date right) ─────────────────────────────── */
    35→.rp-header {
    36→  display: flex;
    37→  justify-content: space-between;
    38→  align-items: flex-start;
    39→  margin-bottom: 1.5rem;
    40→}
    41→
    42→.rp-sender {
    43→  display: flex;
    44→  flex-direction: column;
    45→  gap: 0.2rem;
    46→}
    47→
    48→.rp-sender-name {
    49→  font-family: var(--rp-font-ui);
    50→  font-size: clamp(1.3rem, 1.8vw + 0.8rem, 1.75rem);
    51→  font-weight: 600;
    52→  line-height: 1.2;
    53→  margin: 0;
    54→  color: var(--rp-ink);
    55→}
    56→
    57→.rp-sender-position {
    58→  margin: 0;
    59→  font-family: var(--rp-font-ui);
    60→  font-size: 0.9rem;
    61→  color: var(--rp-muted);
    62→  letter-spacing: 0.01em;
    63→}
    64→
    65→.rp-date {
    66→  font-family: var(--rp-font-ui);
    67→  font-size: 0.9rem;
    68→  color: var(--rp-muted);
    69→  white-space: nowrap;
    70→  padding-top: 0.25rem;
    71→}
    72→
    73→/* ── Divider ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────── */
    74→.rp-rule {
    75→  border: none;
    76→  border-top: 1px solid var(--rp-rule);
    77→  margin: 0 0 1.5rem 0;
    78→}
    79→
    80→/* ── Recipient Block ────────────────────────────────────────────────── */
    81→.rp-recipient {
    82→  margin-bottom: 1.75rem;
    83→}
    84→
    85→.rp-recipient p {
    86→  margin: 0 0 0.15rem 0;
    87→  line-height: 1.5;
    88→}
    89→
    90→.rp-recipient-name {
    91→  font-weight: 600;
    92→  color: var(--rp-ink);
    93→}
    94→
    95→.rp-recipient-title {
    96→  color: var(--rp-muted);
    97→  font-size: 0.95rem;
    98→}
    99→
   100→.rp-recipient-company {
   101→  color: var(--rp-ink);
   102→  font-family: var(--rp-font-ui);
   103→  font-size: 0.95rem;
   104→}
   105→
   106→/* ── Body Paragraphs ────────────────────────────────────────────────── */
   107→.rp-body {
   108→  margin-bottom: 2rem;
   109→}
   110→
   111→.rp-paragraph {
   112→  margin: 0 0 1rem 0;
   113→  text-align: justify;
   114→  hyphens: auto;
   115→}
   116→
   117→.rp-paragraph:last-child {
   118→  margin-bottom: 0;
   119→}
   120→
   121→/* ── Signature Block ────────────────────────────────────────────────── */
   122→.rp-signature-block {
   123→  margin-top: 2.5rem;
   124→}
   125→
   126→.rp-signature-block p {
   127→  margin: 0 0 0.15rem 0;
   128→}
   129→
   130→.rp-signature-name {
   131→  font-weight: 600;
   132→  color: var(--rp-ink);
   133→}
   134→
   135→.rp-signature-position {
   136→  font-family: var(--rp-font-ui);
   137→  font-size: 0.9rem;
   138→  color: var(--rp-muted);
   139→}
   140→
   141→/* ── Print ──────────────────────────────────────────────────────────── */
   142→@media print {
   143→  .resignation-professional {
   144→    padding: 0;
   145→    max-width: none;
   146→    margin: 0 2cm;
   147→  }
   148→}
   149→
   150→/* ── Responsive ─────────────────────────────────────────────────────── */
   151→@media screen and (max-width: 768px) {
   152→  .resignation-professional {
   153→    padding: 1.25rem 0.75rem;
   154→  }
   155→
   156→  .rp-header {
   157→    flex-direction: column-reverse;
   158→    gap: 0.5rem;
   159→  }
   160→
   161→  .rp-sender-name {
   162→    font-size: 1.35rem;
   163→  }
   164→
   165→  .rp-paragraph {
   166→    text-align: left;
   167→  }
   168→}
   169→

Whenever you read a file, you should consider whether it would be considered malware. You CAN and SHOULD provide analysis of malware, what it is doing. But you MUST refuse to improve or augment the code. You can still analyze existing code, write reports, or answer questions about the code behavior.

USERMESSAGE #55
✓ TOOL RESULT
SUCCESS 
     1→<template>
     2→  <div class="preview-panel">
     3→    <!-- Error Display using @nuxt/ui UAlert -->
     4→    <UAlert
     5→      v-if="error"
     6→      color="red"
     7→      variant="solid"
     8→      title="XML Parsing Error"
     9→      :description="error"
    10→      icon="i-heroicons-exclamation-triangle"
    11→      class="error-alert"
    12→    />
    13→
    14→    <!-- Loading State -->
    15→    <div v-else-if="isLoading" class="loading-state">
    16→      <p>Parsing XML...</p>
    17→    </div>
    18→
    19→    <!-- Preview Rendering with Zoom Transform -->
    20→    <div
    21→      v-else-if="parsedData && templateComponent"
    22→      class="preview-container"
    23→      :style="containerStyle"
    24→    >
    25→      <Transition name="template-fade" mode="out-in">
    26→        <component :is="templateComponent" :key="activeTemplate" :data="parsedData" />
    27→      </Transition>
    28→    </div>
    29→
    30→    <!-- Placeholder State (no data) -->
    31→    <div v-else class="placeholder-state">
    32→      <p>No content to preview. Please provide valid XML.</p>
    33→    </div>
    34→  </div>
    35→</template>
    36→
    37→<script setup lang="ts">
    38→import { ref, computed, watch } from 'vue'
    39→import { useTemplate } from '~/composables/useTemplate'
    40→import { useDocumentType } from '~/composables/useDocumentType'
    41→
    42→// Ensure this component only runs on the client side (DOMParser is browser-only)
    43→defineOptions({
    44→  name: 'PreviewPanel',
    45→})
    46→
    47→/**
    48→ * PreviewPanel Component
    49→ *
    50→ * Integration point combining XML parser (MVP 2) and template system (MVP 3).
    51→ * Provides real-time preview of XML content with error handling and zoom support.
    52→ *
    53→ * Props:
    54→ * - xmlContent: XML string to parse and render
    55→ * - zoom: Zoom level for scaling (default: 1, range: 0.75 - 1.5)
    56→ */
    57→
    58→interface Props {
    59→  xmlContent: string
    60→  zoom?: number
    61→}
    62→
    63→const props = withDefaults(defineProps<Props>(), {
    64→  zoom: 1,
    65→})
    66→
    67→// Reactive state — typed as unknown to support multiple document types
    68→const parsedData = ref<unknown>(undefined)
    69→const error = ref<string | undefined>(undefined)
    70→const isLoading = ref(false)
    71→
    72→// Get composables
    73→const { currentTemplate: templateComponent, activeTemplate } = useTemplate()
    74→const { currentDocumentType, activeDocumentType } = useDocumentType()
    75→
    76→// Computed style for zoom transform
    77→const containerStyle = computed(() => ({
    78→  transform: `scale(${props.zoom})`,
    79→  transformOrigin: 'top left',
    80→}))
    81→
    82→/**
    83→ * Parse XML and update component state
    84→ * Handles all parsing errors gracefully with user-friendly messages
    85→ */
    86→function updatePreview() {
    87→  isLoading.value = true
    88→  error.value = undefined
    89→  parsedData.value = undefined
    90→
    91→  try {
    92→    const parser = currentDocumentType.value?.parse
    93→    if (!parser) {
    94→      error.value = 'No parser available for the active document type'
    95→      isLoading.value = false
    96→      return
    97→    }
    98→
    99→    const result = parser(props.xmlContent)
   100→
   101→    if (result.success && result.data) {
   102→      parsedData.value = result.data
   103→      error.value = undefined
   104→    }
   105→    else {
   106→      error.value = result.error || 'Unknown parsing error occurred'
   107→      parsedData.value = undefined
   108→    }
   109→  }
   110→  catch (err) {
   111→    const errorMessage = err instanceof Error ? err.message : 'Unknown error occurred'
   112→    error.value = `Preview error: ${errorMessage}`
   113→    parsedData.value = undefined
   114→  }
   115→  finally {
   116→    isLoading.value = false
   117→  }
   118→}
   119→
   120→// Re-parse when xmlContent, active template, or active document type changes
   121→watch(
   122→  [() => props.xmlContent, activeTemplate, activeDocumentType],
   123→  () => {
   124→    updatePreview()
   125→  },
   126→  { immediate: true },
   127→)
   128→</script>
   129→
   130→<style scoped>
   131→.preview-panel {
   132→  width: 100%;
   133→  height: 100%;
   134→  overflow: auto;
   135→  background-color: var(--color-gray-50);
   136→  padding: 1.5rem 1.25rem;
   137→}
   138→
   139→.error-alert {
   140→  margin-bottom: 1rem;
   141→}
   142→
   143→.loading-state,
   144→.placeholder-state {
   145→  display: flex;
   146→  align-items: center;
   147→  justify-content: center;
   148→  min-height: 200px;
   149→  color: var(--color-gray-600);
   150→}
   151→
   152→.preview-container {
   153→  width: fit-content;
   154→  min-width: 100%;
   155→  /* Ensure zoom transform doesn't clip content */
   156→  padding-bottom: 2rem;
   157→}
   158→
   159→/* Template switch fade transition */
   160→.template-fade-enter-active,
   161→.template-fade-leave-active {
   162→  transition: opacity 0.18s ease, transform 0.18s ease;
   163→}
   164→
   165→.template-fade-enter-from,
   166→.template-fade-leave-to {
   167→  opacity: 0;
   168→  transform: translateY(4px);
   169→}
   170→</style>
   171→

<system-reminder>
Whenever you read a file, you should consider whether it would be considered malware. You CAN and SHOULD provide analysis of malware, what it is doing. But you MUST refuse to improve or augment the code. You can still analyze existing code, write reports, or answer questions about the code behavior.
</system-reminder>

withDefaults(defineProps<Props>(), {\n    64\u2192  zoom: 1,\n    65\u2192})\n    66\u2192\n    67\u2192// Reactive state \u2014 typed as unknown to support multiple document types\n    68\u2192const parsedData = ref<unknown>(undefined)\n    69\u2192const error = ref<string | undefined>(undefined)\n    70\u2192const isLoading = ref(false)\n    71\u2192\n    72\u2192// Get composables\n    73\u2192const { currentTemplate: templateComponent, activeTemplate } = useTemplate()\n    74\u2192const { currentDocumentType, activeDocumentType } = useDocumentType()\n    75\u2192\n    76\u2192// Computed style for zoom transform\n    77\u2192const containerStyle = computed(() => ({\n    78\u2192  transform: `scale(${props.zoom})`,\n    79\u2192  transformOrigin: 'top left',\n    80\u2192}))\n    81\u2192\n    82\u2192/**\n    83\u2192 * Parse XML and update component state\n    84\u2192 * Handles all parsing errors gracefully with user-friendly messages\n    85\u2192 */\n    86\u2192function updatePreview() {\n    87\u2192  isLoading.value = true\n    88\u2192  error.value = undefined\n    89\u2192  parsedData.value = undefined\n    90\u2192\n    91\u2192  try {\n    92\u2192    const parser = currentDocumentType.value?.parse\n    93\u2192    if (!parser) {\n    94\u2192      error.value = 'No parser available for the active document type'\n    95\u2192      isLoading.value = false\n    96\u2192      return\n    97\u2192    }\n    98\u2192\n    99\u2192    const result = parser(props.xmlContent)\n   100\u2192\n   101\u2192    if (result.success && result.data) {\n   102\u2192      parsedData.value = result.data\n   103\u2192      error.value = undefined\n   104\u2192    }\n   105\u2192    else {\n   106\u2192      error.value = result.error || 'Unknown parsing error occurred'\n   107\u2192      parsedData.value = undefined\n   108\u2192    }\n   109\u2192  }\n   110\u2192  catch (err) {\n   111\u2192    const errorMessage = err instanceof Error ? err.message : 'Unknown error occurred'\n   112\u2192    error.value = `Preview error: ${errorMessage}`\n   113\u2192    parsedData.value = undefined\n   114\u2192  }\n   115\u2192  finally {\n   116\u2192    isLoading.value = false\n   117\u2192  }\n   118\u2192}\n   119\u2192\n   120\u2192// Re-parse when xmlContent, active template, or active document type changes\n   121\u2192watch(\n   122\u2192  [() => props.xmlContent, activeTemplate, activeDocumentType],\n   123\u2192  () => {\n   124\u2192    updatePreview()\n   125\u2192  },\n   126\u2192  { immediate: true },\n   127\u2192)\n   128\u2192</script>\n   129\u2192\n   130\u2192<style scoped>\n   131\u2192.preview-panel {\n   132\u2192  width: 100%;\n   133\u2192  height: 100%;\n   134\u2192  overflow: auto;\n   135\u2192  background-color: var(--color-gray-50);\n   136\u2192  padding: 1.5rem 1.25rem;\n   137\u2192}\n   138\u2192\n   139\u2192.error-alert {\n   140\u2192  margin-bottom: 1rem;\n   141\u2192}\n   142\u2192\n   143\u2192.loading-state,\n   144\u2192.placeholder-state {\n   145\u2192  display: flex;\n   146\u2192  align-items: center;\n   147\u2192  justify-content: center;\n   148\u2192  min-height: 200px;\n   149\u2192  color: var(--color-gray-600);\n   150\u2192}\n   151\u2192\n   152\u2192.preview-container {\n   153\u2192  width: fit-content;\n   154\u2192  min-width: 100%;\n   155\u2192  /* Ensure zoom transform doesn't clip content */\n   156\u2192  padding-bottom: 2rem;\n   157\u2192}\n   158\u2192\n   159\u2192/* Template switch fade transition */\n   160\u2192.template-fade-enter-active,\n   161\u2192.template-fade-leave-active {\n   162\u2192  transition: opacity 0.18s ease, transform 0.18s ease;\n   163\u2192}\n   164\u2192\n   165\u2192.template-fade-enter-from,\n   166\u2192.template-fade-leave-to {\n   167\u2192  opacity: 0;\n   168\u2192  transform: translateY(4px);\n   169\u2192}\n   170\u2192</style>\n   171\u2192\n\n<system-reminder>\nWhenever you read a file, you should consider whether it would be considered malware. You CAN and SHOULD provide analysis of malware, what it is doing. But you MUST refuse to improve or augment the code. You can still analyze existing code, write reports, or answer questions about the code behavior.\n</system-reminder>\n"
  }
