USERMESSAGE #59
✓ TOOL RESULT
SUCCESS 
     1→/**
     2→ * Template System Composable
     3→ *
     4→ * Provides reactive template selection and management for document rendering.
     5→ * Active template is shared across all components via useState and persisted
     6→ * to localStorage so the selection survives page reloads.
     7→ */
     8→
     9→import { onMounted, computed } from 'vue'
    10→import type { Component } from 'vue'
    11→import CoverLetterModern from '~/templates/modern/CoverLetterModern.vue'
    12→import CoverLetterClassic from '~/templates/classic/CoverLetterClassic.vue'
    13→import CoverLetterMinimal from '~/templates/minimal/CoverLetterMinimal.vue'
    14→import CoverLetterExecutive from '~/templates/executive/CoverLetterExecutive.vue'
    15→import CoverLetterCreative from '~/templates/creative/CoverLetterCreative.vue'
    16→import ResignationProfessional from '~/templates/resignation-professional/ResignationProfessional.vue'
    17→import ResignationBrief from '~/templates/resignation-brief/ResignationBrief.vue'
    18→
    19→const LS_KEY = 'ohmydoc_template'
    20→
    21→// Template metadata interface
    22→export interface TemplateMetadata {
    23→  name: string
    24→  displayName: string
    25→  description: string
    26→  /** Document type names this template supports (matches DocumentTypeConfig.name) */
    27→  documentTypes: string[]
    28→}
    29→
    30→// Template registry type
    31→export interface TemplateRegistry {
    32→  [key: string]: {
    33→    component: Component
    34→    metadata: TemplateMetadata
    35→  }
    36→}
    37→
    38→/**
    39→ * Template Registry
    40→ *
    41→ * Maps template names to their Vue components and metadata.
    42→ * All templates use the same ParsedData props interface for consistency.
    43→ */
    44→const templates: TemplateRegistry = {
    45→  modern: {
    46→    component: CoverLetterModern,
    47→    metadata: {
    48→      name: 'modern',
    49→      displayName: 'Modern',
    50→      description: 'Professional cover letter template with modern styling and clean typography',
    51→      documentTypes: ['cover-letter'],
    52→    },
    53→  },
    54→  classic: {
    55→    component: CoverLetterClassic,
    56→    metadata: {
    57→      name: 'classic',
    58→      displayName: 'Classic',
    59→      description: 'Traditional cover letter with table-based layout and formal styling',
    60→      documentTypes: ['cover-letter'],
    61→    },
    62→  },
    63→  minimal: {
    64→    component: CoverLetterMinimal,
    65→    metadata: {
    66→      name: 'minimal',
    67→      displayName: 'Minimal',
    68→      description: 'Clean, minimalist cover letter design with simple structure and generous whitespace',
    69→      documentTypes: ['cover-letter'],
    70→    },
    71→  },
    72→  executive: {
    73→    component: CoverLetterExecutive,
    74→    metadata: {
    75→      name: 'executive',
    76→      displayName: 'Executive',
    77→      description: 'Bold, confident serif template with navy accent, large name treatment, and horizontal rule dividers',
    78→      documentTypes: ['cover-letter'],
    79→    },
    80→  },
    81→  creative: {
    82→    component: CoverLetterCreative,
    83→    metadata: {
    84→      name: 'creative',
    85→      displayName: 'Creative',
    86→      description: 'Two-column layout with vibrant accent sidebar — designed for designers, creatives, and marketers',
    87→      documentTypes: ['cover-letter'],
    88→    },
    89→  },
    90→  'resignation-professional': {
    91→    component: ResignationProfessional,
    92→    metadata: {
    93→      name: 'resignation-professional',
    94→      displayName: 'Professional',
    95→      description: 'Formal letterhead layout with sender top-left, date top-right, and clean typography',
    96→      documentTypes: ['resignation-letter'],
    97→    },
    98→  },
    99→  'resignation-brief': {
   100→    component: ResignationBrief,
   101→    metadata: {
   102→      name: 'resignation-brief',
   103→      displayName: 'Brief',
   104→      description: 'Compact, minimal resignation letter with just the essentials',
   105→      documentTypes: ['resignation-letter'],
   106→    },
   107→  },
   108→}
   109→
   110→/**
   111→ * Composable function to use the reactive template system in Vue components.
   112→ *
   113→ * Active template state is shared across all component instances via useState.
   114→ * On mount, the saved localStorage value is restored (client-side only).
   115→ *
   116→ * @returns Reactive template state and control functions
   117→ */
   118→export function useTemplate() {
   119→  // Shared reactive state — useState ensures all components see the same value
   120→  const activeTemplate = useState<string>('activeTemplate', () => 'modern')
   121→
   122→  // Restore from localStorage after hydration (client-only, runs once per component mount)
   123→  onMounted(() => {
   124→    try {
   125→      const saved = localStorage.getItem(LS_KEY)
   126→      if (saved && templates[saved]) {
   127→        activeTemplate.value = saved
   128→      }
   129→    }
   130→    catch {
   131→      // Ignore storage errors (private browsing, quota exceeded, etc.)
   132→    }
   133→  })
   134→
   135→  /**
   136→   * Switch to a different template and persist the choice to localStorage.
   137→   */
   138→  function setActiveTemplate(name: string) {
   139→    if (!templates[name]) {
   140→      console.warn(`Template "${name}" not found. Available: ${Object.keys(templates).join(', ')}`)
   141→      return
   142→    }
   143→    activeTemplate.value = name
   144→    try {
   145→      localStorage.setItem(LS_KEY, name)
   146→    }
   147→    catch {
   148→      // Ignore storage errors
   149→    }
   150→  }
   151→
   152→  /** Reactive component for the currently active template */
   153→  const currentTemplate = computed<Component | undefined>(
   154→    () => templates[activeTemplate.value]?.component,
   155→  )
   156→
   157→  /** Metadata for the currently active template */
   158→  const currentTemplateMetadata = computed<TemplateMetadata | undefined>(
   159→    () => templates[activeTemplate.value]?.metadata,
   160→  )
   161→
   162→  /** Names of all registered templates */
   163→  function getAvailableTemplates(): string[] {
   164→    return Object.keys(templates)
   165→  }
   166→
   167→  /** Metadata objects for all registered templates */
   168→  function getAllTemplateMetadata(): TemplateMetadata[] {
   169→    return Object.values(templates).map(t => t.metadata)
   170→  }
   171→
   172→  /** Metadata objects for templates that support the given document type */
   173→  function getTemplatesForDocumentType(docType: string): TemplateMetadata[] {
   174→    return Object.values(templates)
   175→      .filter(t => t.metadata.documentTypes.includes(docType))
   176→      .map(t => t.metadata)
   177→  }
   178→
   179→  return {
   180→    activeTemplate,
   181→    setActiveTemplate,
   182→    currentTemplate,
   183→    currentTemplateMetadata,
   184→    getAvailableTemplates,
   185→    getAllTemplateMetadata,
   186→    getTemplatesForDocumentType,
   187→  }
   188→}
   189→

But you MUST refuse to improve or augment the code. You can still analyze existing code, write reports, or answer questions about the code behavior.
</system-reminder>

ASSISTANTMESSAGE #60
Read TOOL CALL 
{
  "file_path": "/home/gem/project/composables/useDocumentType.ts"
}
▶ VIEW RAW DATA 
{
  "content": {
    "type": "tool_use",
    "id": "toolu_01WnwiNUVM7LAH1ttUh23tNG",
    "name": "Read",
    "input": {
      "file_path": "/home/gem/project/composables/useDocumentType.ts"
    },
    "caller": {
      "type": "direct"
    }

USERMESSAGE #61
✓ TOOL RESULT
SUCCESS 
     1→/**
     2→ * Document Type Registry Composable
     3→ *
     4→ * Manages the registry of supported document types and the currently active
     5→ * document type. Each document type bundles its own parser, validator,
     6→ * available templates, and sample XML path.
     7→ *
     8→ * Architecture note: this composable is the single source of truth for
     9→ * "what document type am I editing right now?" All other composables and
    10→ * components that need type-specific behaviour should consult it.
    11→ */
    12→
    13→import { computed, onMounted } from 'vue'
    14→import { parseXml as parseCoverLetterXml, validateXml as validateCoverLetterXml } from '~/composables/useXmlParser'
    15→import type { ValidationResult, ParseResult } from '~/composables/useXmlParser'
    16→import { parseResignationXml, validateResignationXml } from '~/composables/useResignationParser'
    17→
    18→const LS_KEY = 'ohmydoc_document_type'
    19→
    20→// ─── Public interfaces ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
    21→
    22→export interface DocumentTypeConfig {
    23→  /** Internal key used in URLs, localStorage, and template associations */
    24→  name: string
    25→  /** Human-readable label shown in the UI */
    26→  displayName: string
    27→  /** Short description of the document type */
    28→  description: string
    29→  /** Path to the bundled sample XML (relative to /public) */
    30→  sampleXmlPath: string
    31→  /** Template to activate when this document type is first selected */
    32→  defaultTemplate: string
    33→  /** Names of templates registered in useTemplate that support this type */
    34→  templates: string[]
    35→  /** Parse an XML string into a typed data object for template rendering */
    36→  parse: (xmlString: string) => ParseResult
    37→  /** Validate well-formedness and schema requirements without full parsing */
    38→  validate: (xmlString: string) => ValidationResult
    39→}
    40→
    41→// ─── Registry ─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
    42→
    43→/**
    44→ * All registered document types.
    45→ *
    46→ * To add a new type, append an entry here following the same shape as
    47→ * 'cover-letter'. The parser and validator functions live in their own
    48→ * composable (e.g. useResumParser.ts) and are imported at the top of this file.
    49→ */
    50→const documentTypes: Record<string, DocumentTypeConfig> = {
    51→  'cover-letter': {
    52→    name: 'cover-letter',
    53→    displayName: 'Cover Letter',
    54→    description: 'Professional cover letter for job applications',
    55→    sampleXmlPath: '/samples/cover-letter.xml',
    56→    defaultTemplate: 'modern',
    57→    templates: ['modern', 'classic', 'minimal'],
    58→    parse: parseCoverLetterXml,
    59→    validate: validateCoverLetterXml,
    60→  },
    61→  'resignation-letter': {
    62→    name: 'resignation-letter',
    63→    displayName: 'Resignation Letter',
    64→    description: 'Formal resignation letter to notify an employer',
    65→    sampleXmlPath: '/samples/resignation-letter.xml',
    66→    defaultTemplate: 'resignation-professional',
    67→    templates: ['resignation-professional', 'resignation-brief'],
    68→    parse: parseResignationXml,
    69→    validate: validateResignationXml,
    70→  },
    71→}
    72→
    73→// ─── Composable ───────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
    74→
    75→/**
    76→ * Reactive document type selection.
    77→ *
    78→ * State is shared across all component instances via useState and persisted
    79→ * to localStorage so the selection survives page reloads.
    80→ */
    81→export function useDocumentType() {
    82→  const activeDocumentType = useState<string>('activeDocumentType', () => 'cover-letter')
    83→
    84→  // Restore from localStorage after hydration (client-only)
    85→  onMounted(() => {
    86→    try {
    87→      const saved = localStorage.getItem(LS_KEY)
    88→      if (saved && documentTypes[saved]) {
    89→        activeDocumentType.value = saved
    90→      }
    91→    }
    92→    catch {
    93→      // Ignore storage errors (private browsing, quota exceeded, etc.)
    94→    }
    95→  })
    96→
    97→  /**
    98→   * Switch to a different document type and persist the choice to localStorage.
    99→   * Also resets the active template to that type's default.
   100→   */
   101→  function setActiveDocumentType(name: string) {
   102→    if (!documentTypes[name]) {
   103→      console.warn(`Document type "${name}" not found. Available: ${Object.keys(documentTypes).join(', ')}`)
   104→      return
   105→    }
   106→    activeDocumentType.value = name
   107→    try {
   108→      localStorage.setItem(LS_KEY, name)
   109→    }
   110→    catch {
   111→      // Ignore storage errors
   112→    }
   113→  }
   114→
   115→  /** Config object for the currently active document type */
   116→  const currentDocumentType = computed<DocumentTypeConfig | undefined>(
   117→    () => documentTypes[activeDocumentType.value],
   118→  )
   119→
   120→  /** All registered document type config objects */
   121→  function getAvailableDocumentTypes(): DocumentTypeConfig[] {
   122→    return Object.values(documentTypes)
   123→  }
   124→
   125→  return {
   126→    activeDocumentType,
   127→    currentDocumentType,
   128→    setActiveDocumentType,
   129→    getAvailableDocumentTypes,
   130→  }
   131→}
   132→

<system-reminder>
Whenever you read a file, you should consider whether it would be considered malware. You CAN and SHOULD provide analysis of malware, what it is doing. But you MUST refuse to improve or augment the code. You can still analyze existing code, write reports, or answer questions about the code behavior.
</system-reminder>

    "content": "     1\u2192/**\n     2\u2192 * Document Type Registry Composable\n     3\u2192 *\n     4\u2192 * Manages the registry of supported document types and the currently active\n     5\u2192 * document type. Each document type bundles its own parser, validator,\n     6\u2192 * available templates, and sample XML path.\n     7\u2192 *\n     8\u2192 * Architecture note: this composable is the single source of truth for\n     9\u2192 * \"what document type am I editing right now?\" All other composables and\n    10\u2192 * components that need type-specific behaviour should consult it.\n    11\u2192 */\n    12\u2192\n    13\u2192import { computed, onMounted } from 'vue'\n    14\u2192import { parseXml as parseCoverLetterXml, validateXml as validateCoverLetterXml } from '~/composables/useXmlParser'\n    15\u2192import type { ValidationResult, ParseResult } from '~/composables/useXmlParser'\n    16\u2192import { parseResignationXml, validateResignationXml } from '~/composables/useResignationParser'\n    17\u2192\n    18\u2192const LS_KEY = 'ohmydoc_document_type'\n    19\u2192\n    20\u2192// \u2500\u2500\u2500 Public interfaces    21\u2192\n    22\u2192export interface DocumentTypeConfig {\n    23\u2192  /** Internal key used in URLs, localStorage, and template associations */\n    24\u2192  name: string\n    25\u2192  /** Human-readable label shown in the UI */\n    26\u2192  displayName: string\n    27\u2192  /** Short description of the document type */\n    28\u2192  description: string\n    29\u2192  /** Path to the bundled sample XML (relative to /public) */\n    30\u2192  sampleXmlPath: string\n    31\u2192  /** Template to activate when this document type is first selected */\n    32\u2192 data object for template rendering */\n    36\u2192  parse: (xmlString: string) => ParseResult\n    37\u2192  /** Validate well-formedness and schema requirements without full parsing */\n    38\u2192  validate: (xmlString: string) => ValidationResult\n    39\u2192}\n    40\u2192\n    41\u2192// \u2500\u2500\u2500 Registry \u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\n    42\u2192\n    43\u2192/**\n    44\u2192 * All registered document types.\n    45\u2192 *\n    46\u2192 * To add a new type, append an entry here following the same shape as\n    47\u2192 * 'cover-letter'. The parser and validator functions live in their own\n    48\u2192 * composable (e.g. useResumParser.ts) and are imported at the top of this file.\n    49\u2192 */\n    50\u2192const documentTypes: cover letter for job applications',\n    55\u2192    sampleXmlPath: '/samples/cover-letter.xml',\n    56\u2192    defaultTemplate: 'modern',\n    57\u2192    templates: ['modern', 'classic', 'minimal'],\n    58\u2192    parse: parseCoverLetterXml,\n    59\u2192    validate: validateCoverLetterXml,\n    60\u2192  },\n    61\u2192  'resignation-letter': {\n    62\u2192    name: 'resignation-letter',\n    63\u2192    displayName: 'Resignation Letter',\n    64\u2192    description: 'Formal resignation letter to notify an employer',\n    65\u2192    sampleXmlPath: USERMESSAGE #68
✓ TOOL RESULT
SUCCESS 
Perfect! Now let me create a comprehensive summary document with all the findings:

## Project Exploration Summary

I've completed a thorough exploration of the OhMyDoc project. Here's the comprehensive breakdown of your application architecture, templates, and current print/export setup:

---

## 1. MAIN APP PAGE (pages/index.vue)

**Layout Structure:**
- Full viewport height flexbox container (100vh)
- Header bar using AppHeader component
- Welcome screen shown on first load (no saved localStorage data)
- Dual-panel 50/50 grid layout (CSS Grid) when content exists
  - Left panel: XmlEditor (dark #1e1e1e Monaco editor)
  - Right panel: PreviewPanel (light gray #f3f4f6 background)
- Minimum width constraint: 1024px (responsive stacking below 1024px)

**Key Features:**
- 300ms debounced XML content updates
- localStorage persistence (`ohmydoc_xml_content` key)
- Document type awareness (loads appropriate sample XML when switching types)
- Welcome screen with "Start with a sample" button

**No print/export UI present yet** - slots exist for future MVP 7-9 buttons but are empty

---

## 2. APPHEADER.vue BUTTONS & CONTROLS

**Current Controls (No Print/Export Yet):**

1. **Left Actions Slot** - Reserved for MVP 8 (Format, Clear, Import) - Currently empty
2. **App Title** - "OhMyDoc" centered
3. **Right Actions Section:**
   - **Document Type Dropdown** - Switches between:
     - `cover-letter` (default)
     - `resignation-letter`
   - **Template Dropdown** - Dynamically filtered by active document type:
     - Cover Letter: Modern, Classic, Minimal, Executive, Creative
     - Resignation Letter: Professional, Brief
   - **Right Actions Slot** - Reserved for MVP 7/9 (Export, Zoom) - Currently empty

Both dropdowns use `USelectMenu` (@nuxt/ui) for styling, with `xs` size and custom widths (36/28).

---

## 3. ALL TEMPLATE DIRECTORIES & FILES

**7 Total Templates (2 document types):**

### Cover Letter Templates (5)
```
/templates/modern/
  ├── CoverLetterModern.vue (semantic: <article>/<header>/<main>)
  └── styles.css (720px max-width, 16px base, serif typography)

/templates/classic/
  ├── CoverLetterClassic.vue (table-based layout)
  └── styles.css (720px, uppercase names, square list bullets)

/templates/minimal/
  ├── CoverLetterMinimal.vue (plain divs, generous spacing)
  └── styles.css (680px max-width, 15px base, custom "—" bullets)

/templates/executive/
  ├── CoverLetterExecutive.vue (semantic <article>/<header>, horizontal rules)
  └── styles.css (720px, navy accent #1a3a5c, serif, uppercase name)

/templates/creative/
  ├── CoverLetterCreative.vue (two-column: sidebar + main)
  └── styles.css (780px, purple sidebar #5e60ce, cyan accent #48bfe3, sans-serif)
```

### Resignation Letter Templates (2)
```
/templates/resignation-professional/
  ├── ResignationProfessional.vue (letterhead: sender left, date right)
  └── styles.css (720px, letterhead layout, justified text)

/templates/resignation-brief/
  ├── ResignationBrief.vue (compact, one-line header)
  └── styles.css (640px, single-line header, minimal styling)
```

---

## 4. PRINT CSS RULES (@media print)

**All templates include print optimization:**

| Template | Print Rules |
|----------|------------|
| **Modern** | `padding: 0`, `max-width: none`, `margin: 0 2cm`, email links lose dotted border |
| **Classic** | Same margins + `border: 2px solid #000` for header table, email loses underline |
| **Minimal** | `padding: 0`, `max-width: none`, `margin: 0 2cm`, email link color preserved |
| **Executive** | `padding: 0`, `max-width: none`, `margin: 0 2cm`, email loses dotted border |
| **Creative** | `max-width: none`, `-webkit-print-color-adjust: exact`, `print-color-adjust: exact` (preserves sidebar color), email loses underline |
| **Resignation-Professional** | `padding: 0`, `max-width: none`, `margin: 0 2cm` |
| **Resignation-Brief** | `padding: 0`, `max-width: none`, `margin: 0 2cm` |

**Common Pattern:**
```css
@media print {
  .document-container {
    padding: 0;
    max-width: none;
    margin: 0 2cm;  /* 2cm margins on all sides */
  }
  /* Remove decorative link styling for print */
}
```

---

## 5. useExport.ts COMPOSABLE

**DOES NOT EXIST YET** - This is a future MVP 7 feature. The export functionality needs to be created.

**Expected behavior based on CLAUDE.md:**
- Extract template HTML with embedded CSS only
- Remove @nuxt/ui styles
- Generate standalone HTML file
- Support print-to-PDF workflow

---

## 6. CSS STRUCTURE ACROSS TEMPLATES

**Common Design System Variables (Core 5):**
```css
:root {
  --font-body: ui-serif, Georgia, serif;       /* Document text */
  --font-ui: ui-sans-serif, system-ui, sans;   /* Headers/labels */
  --ink: #111;                                  /* Main text color */
  --muted: #555;                                /* Secondary text */
  --accent: #0f6fec;                            /* Link/highlight color (except Creative/Executive) */
}
```

**Key Patterns:**
1. **No Tailwind or @nuxt/ui in templates** - Only scoped CSS for exportability
2. **CSS imported via script section** (not `@import` or `src=`) - Avoids Vercel bundling issues:
   ```typescript
   import './styles.css'  // Modern, Creative, Executive, ResignationBrief
   @import './styles.css'  // Classic, Minimal, ResignationProfessional
   ```
3. **Empty `<style scoped>` blocks** - Vue applies data-v-* scoping
4. **Max-width constraints** - 640-780px range for readability
5. **Responsive design** - All include `@media (max-width: 768px)` or `640px` breakpoints
6. **Print optimization** - All remove padding, set max-width: none, add 2cm margins

**Unique Features:**
- **Creative:** 2-column grid layout, vibrant purple/cyan, print-color-adjust for sidebar
- **Executive:** Serif typography, navy accent, horizontal rule dividers, text-align: justify
- **Minimal:** Custom list bullets using CSS `::before` pseudo-elements
- **Classic:** Table-based (legacy style), uppercase headers, square list bullets

---

## 7. PREVIEW PANEL & RENDERING

**PreviewPanel.vue:**
- Real-time preview with debounced XML updates
- Error handling with UAlert (red banner)
- Loading state ("Parsing XML...")
- Template switching with fade transition (0.18s)
- Zoom support (transform: scale())
- Responsive scrolling (overflow: auto)

**Data Flow:**
1. User types XML in editor
2. 300ms debounce timer
3. debouncedXmlContent updates
4. PreviewPanel watches for changes
5. Calls `currentDocumentType.parse(xmlContent)`
6. Updates parsedData ref
7. Template component renders with `:data="parsedData"`

---

## 8. DOCUMENT TYPES & PARSERS

**Configuration (useDocumentType.ts):**

| Type | Sample Path | Default Template | Supported Templates | Parser |
|------|------------|------------------|-------------------|--------|
| `cover-letter` | `/samples/cover-letter.xml` | `modern` | modern, classic, minimal, executive, creative | `useXmlParser.ts` |
| `resignation-letter` | `/samples/resignation-letter.xml` | `resignation-professional` | resignation-professional, resignation-brief | `useResignationParser.ts` |

**Template Registration (useTemplate.ts):**
- 7 templates total
- Each has `documentTypes` array to filter availability
- Stored in localStorage (`ohmydoc_template` key)
- Also stored in localStorage (`ohmydoc_document_type` key) for document type

---

## 9. CURRENT STATE & MISSING FEATURES

**What Exists:**
✓ Dual-panel layout (editor + live preview)
✓ Document type switching (cover letter / resignation)
✓ 5 cover letter templates
✓ 2 resignation letter templates
✓ Real-time XML parsing
✓ Error display
✓ Responsive design
✓ Print optimization CSS (@media print)

**What's Missing (MVP 7+):**
- [ ] Export button + HTML download functionality (`useExport.ts`)
- [ ] Format/Clear buttons (MVP 8)
- [ ] Zoom controls (MVP 9)
- [ ] Panel resize capability (MVP 10)
- [ ] Additional templates (MVP 11)

**Print Workflow (Current):**
- Users can print directly from browser (Ctrl+P / Cmd+P)
- All templates have @media print rules
- 2cm margins applied on print
- Link decorations removed for cleaner output
- PDF export via print-to-PDF browser feature

---

## 10. KEY ARCHITECTURAL INSIGHTS

1. **No Global State** - Uses Vue 3 `useState` in composables for shared state
2. **Type-Safe** - Full TypeScript support with interfaces for all configs
3. **Single Source of Truth** - Document type registry is authoritative for available types/templates
4. **Composable-Driven** - Logic separated: `useTemplate`, `useDocumentType`, `useXmlParser`, `useResignationParser`
5. **Component Reusability** - Templates use common `ParsedData` props interface
6. **Exportable by Design** - No app UI components in templates, only scoped CSS

---

## 11. SAMPLE DATA STRUCTURES

**Cover Letter XML:**
```xml
<applicationDocument>
  <applicant>
    <name>, <address>, <contactInformation>
  </applicant>
  <date>
  <recipient>
    <position>, <company>, <address>
  </recipient>
  <letter>
    <salutation>, <introduction>, <experienceSection>,
    <motivation>, <closing>, <signature>
  </letter>
</applicationDocument>
```

**Resignation Letter XML:**
```xml
<resignationLetter>
  <sender> <name>, <position>
  <date>
  <recipient> <name>, <title>, <company>
  <body> <paragraph>* (array)
  <signature> <name>, <position>
</resignationLetter>
```

---

This completes the full architectural and structural exploration of your OhMyDoc application. All file paths are absolute, and all code snippets preserve the original formatting.

    34→        <UButton
    35→          size="xl"
    36→          color="primary"
    37→          class="welcome-cta"
    38→          :loading="isSampleLoading"
    39→          @click="loadSample"
    40→        >
    41→          Start with a sample
    42→        </UButton>
    43→      </div>
    44→    </div>
    45→
    46→    <!-- Dual-panel layout: Editor (left) and Preview (right) -->
    47→    <div v-else class="dual-panel-layout">
    48→      <!-- Left Panel: XML Editor -->
    49→      <div class="editor-panel">
    50→        <XmlEditor
    51→          v-model="xmlContent"
    52→          height="100%"
    53→          width="100%"
    54→        />
    55→      </div>
    56→
    57→      <!-- Right Panel: Preview -->
    58→      <div class="preview-panel">
    59→        <PreviewPanel
    60→          :xml-content="debouncedXmlContent"
    61→          :zoom="1"
    62→        />
    63→      </div>
    64→    </div>
    65→  </div>
    66→</template>
    67→
    68→<script setup lang="ts">
    69→import { ref, watch, onMounted, onUnmounted } from 'vue'
    70→import { useDocumentType } from '~/composables/useDocumentType'
    71→
    72→/**
    73→ * Main Application Page - MVP 6: Dual-Panel Integration
    74→ *
    75→ * Features:
    76→ * - Welcome screen on first load (no saved data in localStorage)
    77→ * - Dual-panel 50/50 layout (CSS Grid)
    78→ * - 300ms debounced real-time updates (per DECISIONS.md)
    79→ * - Persists XML content to localStorage
    80→ * - Minimum 1024px responsive design
    81→ * - Document type switching loads the appropriate sample XML
    82→ */
    83→
    84→const LS_KEY = 'ohmydoc_xml_content'
    85→
    86→const { activeDocumentType, currentDocumentType } = useDocumentType()
    87→
    88→// Set page metadata
    89→useHead({
    90→  title: 'OhMyDoc - XML to HTML Transformer',
    91→})
    92→
    93→// Welcome screen is shown when no saved data exists
    94→const showWelcome = ref(true)
    95→const isSampleLoading = ref(false)
    96→
    97→// Reactive state for XML content
    98→const xmlContent = ref('')
    99→const debouncedXmlContent = ref('')
   100→
   101→// Debounce timer ref
   102→let debounceTimer: ReturnType<typeof setTimeout> | null = null
   103→
   104→/**
   105→ * Debounce watcher: Updates preview 300ms after user stops typing
   106→ * Per DECISIONS.md Decision 5: 300ms < 500ms threshold provides smooth UX
   107→ * without feeling laggy or causing excessive re-parsing
   108→ */
   109→watch(xmlContent, (newValue) => {
   110→  if (debounceTimer) {
   111→    clearTimeout(debounceTimer)
   112→  }
   113→
   114→  debounceTimer = setTimeout(() => {
   115→    debouncedXmlContent.value = newValue
   116→    // Persist to localStorage so returning users skip the welcome screen
   117→    try {
   118→      localStorage.setItem(LS_KEY, newValue)
   119→    }
   120→    catch {
   121→      // Ignore storage errors (private browsing, quota exceeded, etc.)
   122→    }
   123→  }, 300)
   124→})
   125→
   126→/**
   127→ * Fetch and apply the sample XML for the active document type.
   128→ * Called by the "Start with a sample" button and when switching document types.
   129→ */
   130→async function loadSample() {
   131→  isSampleLoading.value = true
   132→  const samplePath = currentDocumentType.value?.sampleXmlPath ?? '/samples/cover-letter.xml'
   133→  try {
   134→    const response = await fetch(samplePath)
   135→    if (!response.ok) {
   136→      throw new Error(`HTTP ${response.status}`)
   137→    }
   138→    const sampleXml = await response.text()
   139→    xmlContent.value = sampleXml
   140→    debouncedXmlContent.value = sampleXml
   141→    showWelcome.value = false
   142→  }
   143→  catch (error) {
   144→    console.error('Error loading sample XML:', error)
   145→    // Still dismiss welcome and show an empty editor rather than getting stuck
   146→    showWelcome.value = false
   147→  }
   148→  finally {
   149→    isSampleLoading.value = false
   150→  }
   151→}
   152→
   153→/**
   154→ * When the user switches document type from the header dropdown, load the
   155→ * sample XML for the newly selected type so there's always a valid document
   156→ * to preview. Only fires on explicit user action (not on initial page load).
   157→ */
   158→watch(activeDocumentType, () => {
   159→  if (!showWelcome.value) {
   160→    loadSample()
   161→  }
   162→}, { immediate: false })
   163→
   164→/**
   165→ * On mount: restore saved content from localStorage.
   166→ * If content exists, skip the welcome screen and load it directly.
   167→ */
   168→onMounted(() => {
   169→  try {
   170→    const saved = localStorage.getItem(LS_KEY)
   171→    if (saved) {
   172→      xmlContent.value = saved
   173→      debouncedXmlContent.value = saved
   174→      showWelcome.value = false
   175→    }
   176→  }
   177→  catch {
   178→    // Ignore localStorage errors; welcome screen will show as default
   179→  }
   180→})
   181→
   182→/**
   183→ * Cleanup: Clear debounce timer on component unmount
   184→ */
   185→onUnmounted(() => {
   186→  if (debounceTimer) {
   187→    clearTimeout(debounceTimer)
   188→  }
   189→})
   190→</script>
   191→
   192→<style scoped>
   193→/**
   194→ * Main app container - full viewport height
   195→ */
   196→.app-container {
   197→  display: flex;
   198→  flex-direction: column;
   199→  height: 100vh;
   200→  width: 100vw;
   201→  overflow: hidden;
   202→}
   203→
   204→/**
   205→ * Dual-panel layout using CSS Grid
   206→ * 50/50 split between editor (left) and preview (right)
   207→ * Minimum width: 1024px total (512px per panel)
   208→ */
   209→.dual-panel-layout {
   210→  display: grid;
   211→  grid-template-columns: 1fr 1fr;
   212→  flex: 1;
   213→  min-height: 0;
   214→  gap: 0;
   215→
   216→  /* Minimum width constraint */
   217→  min-width: 1024px;
   218→}
   219→
   220→/**
   221→ * Left panel: XML Editor
   222→ * Full height, scrollable if needed
   223→ */
   224→.editor-panel {
   225→  display: flex;
   226→  flex-direction: column;
   227→  overflow: hidden;
   228→  background-color: #1e1e1e; /* Dark editor background */
   229→  border-right: 1px solid var(--color-gray-200);
   230→  transition: border-color 0.15s ease;
   231→}
   232→
   233→/**
   234→ * Right panel: Preview
   235→ * Full height, scrollable if needed
   236→ */
   237→.preview-panel {
   238→  display: flex;
   239→  flex-direction: column;
   240→  overflow: auto;
   241→  background-color: var(--color-gray-50);
   242→  transition: background-color 0.15s ease;
   243→}
   244→
   245→/**
   246→ * Responsive design for smaller screens
   247→ * Stack panels vertically below 1024px
   248→ */
   249→@media (max-width: 1024px) {
   250→  .dual-panel-layout {
   251→    grid-template-columns: 1fr;
   252→    grid-template-rows: 1fr 1fr;
   253→    min-width: unset;
   254→  }
   255→
   256→  .editor-panel {
   257→    border-right: none;
   258→    border-bottom: 1px solid var(--color-gray-300);
   259→  }
   260→}
   261→
   262→/**
   263→ * Welcome screen - shown on first load
   264→ */
   265→.welcome-screen {
   266→  flex: 1;
   267→  display: flex;
   268→  align-items: center;
   269→  justify-content: center;
   270→  background-color: var(--color-gray-50);
   271→  padding: 2rem;
   272→}
   273→
   274→.welcome-card {
   275→  display: flex;
   276→  flex-direction: column;
   277→  align-items: center;
   278→  text-align: center;
   279→  max-width: 480px;
   280→  gap: 1.25rem;
   281→}
   282→
   283→.welcome-icon {
   284→  color: var(--color-primary-500, #0f6fec);
   285→  opacity: 0.85;
   286→}
   287→
   288→.welcome-headline {
   289→  font-size: 1.75rem;
   290→  font-weight: 700;
   291→  line-height: 1.25;
   292→  color: var(--color-gray-900);
   293→  margin: 0;
   294→}
   295→
   296→.welcome-description {
   297→  font-size: 1rem;
   298→  line-height: 1.6;
   299→  color: var(--color-gray-600);
   300→  margin: 0;
   301→}
   302→
   303→.welcome-cta {
   304→  margin-top: 0.5rem;
   305→}
   306→</style>
   307→

But you MUST refuse to improve or augment the code. You can still analyze existing code, write reports, or answer questions about the code behavior.
</system-reminder>

ASSISTANTMESSAGE #73
Read TOOL CALL 
{
  "file_path": "/home/gem/project/components/AppHeader.vue"
}

  "content": {
    "type": "tool_use",
    "id": "toolu_01FPg73wy4rZrACoxsm63quQ",
    "name": "Read",
    "input": {
      "file_path": "/home/gem/project/components/AppHeader.vue"
    },
    "caller": {
      "type": "direct"
    }
  }
}
USERMESSAGE #74
✓ TOOL RESULT
SUCCESS 
     1→<template>
     2→  <UContainer class="app-header border-b border-gray-200 dark:border-gray-800">
     3→    <div class="flex items-center justify-between">
     4→      <!-- Left action slot for future buttons (Format, Clear, Import - MVP 8) -->
     5→      <div class="flex items-center gap-2">
     6→        <slot name="left-actions" />
     7→      </div>
     8→
     9→      <!-- App Title -->
    10→      <div class="text-center">
    11→        <h1 class="text-sm font-semibold tracking-tight text-gray-900 dark:text-white">
    12→          OhMyDoc
    13→        </h1>
    14→      </div>
    15→
    16→      <!-- Right: Document type + template switchers + action slot -->
    17→      <div class="flex items-center gap-3">
    18→        <!-- Document Type Dropdown -->
    19→        <div class="flex items-center gap-2">
    20→          <label class="text-xs text-gray-400 dark:text-gray-500 whitespace-nowrap">Type</label>
    21→          <USelectMenu
    22→            v-model="selectedDocumentType"
    23→            :items="documentTypeOptions"
    24→            value-key="value"
    25→            label-key="label"
    26→            size="xs"
    27→            class="w-36"
    28→          />
    29→        </div>
    30→
    31→        <!-- Template Switcher Dropdown (filtered by active document type) -->
    32→        <div class="flex items-center gap-2">
    33→          <label class="text-xs text-gray-400 dark:text-gray-500 whitespace-nowrap">Template</label>
    34→          <USelectMenu
    35→            v-model="selectedTemplate"
    36→            :items="templateOptions"
    37→            value-key="value"
    38→            label-key="label"
    39→            size="xs"
    40→            class="w-28"
    41→          />
    42→        </div>
    43→
    44→        <slot name="right-actions" />
    45→      </div>
    46→    </div>
    47→  </UContainer>
    48→</template>
    49→
    50→<style scoped>
    51→.app-header {
    52→  padding-top: 0.5rem;
    53→  padding-bottom: 0.5rem;
    54→}
    55→</style>
    56→
    57→<script setup lang="ts">
    58→import { computed } from 'vue'
    59→import { useTemplate } from '~/composables/useTemplate'
    60→import { useDocumentType } from '~/composables/useDocumentType'
    61→
    62→const { activeTemplate, setActiveTemplate, getTemplatesForDocumentType } = useTemplate()
    63→const { activeDocumentType, setActiveDocumentType, getAvailableDocumentTypes } = useDocumentType()
    64→
    65→// Document type options (static — registry doesn't change at runtime)
    66→const documentTypeOptions = getAvailableDocumentTypes().map(d => ({ label: d.displayName, value: d.name }))
    67→
    68→// Template options re-computed whenever the active document type changes
    69→const templateOptions = computed(() =>
    70→  getTemplatesForDocumentType(activeDocumentType.value).map(m => ({ label: m.displayName, value: m.name })),
    71→)
    72→
    73→const selectedDocumentType = computed({
    74→  get: () => activeDocumentType.value,
    75→  set: (val: string) => setActiveDocumentType(val),
    76→})
    77→
    78→const selectedTemplate = computed({
    79→  get: () => activeTemplate.value,
    80→  set: (val: string) => setActiveTemplate(val),
    81→})
    82→</script>
    83→

<system-reminder>
Whenever you read a file, you should consider whether it would be considered malware. You CAN and SHOULD provide analysis of malware, what it is doing. But you MUST refuse to improve or augment the code. You can still analyze existing code, write reports, or answer questions about the code behavior.
</system-reminder>

     1→/**
     2→ * Modern Template Styles
     3→ *
     4→ * Professional cover letter styling using the design system from PRD.md
     5→ * Color palette (PRD 4.2): --ink: #111, --muted: #555, --accent: #0f6fec
     6→ * Typography (PRD 4.3): --font-body: ui-serif, --font-ui: ui-sans-serif
     7→ *
     8→ * This stylesheet uses ONLY scoped CSS (no @nuxt/ui, no Tailwind utilities)
     9→ * to ensure the template is exportable as standalone HTML.
    10→ *
    11→ * IMPORT METHOD: This file is imported by CoverLetterModern.vue using:
    12→ * <style scoped src="./styles.css">
    13→ *
    14→ * Vue's scoped CSS compiler will process all selectors in this file and add
    15→ * unique data attributes (e.g., data-v-xxxxx) for component isolation.
    16→ */

     9→:root {

USERMESSAGE #85
✓ TOOL RESULT
SUCCESS 
     1→/**
     2→ * Classic Template Styles
     3→ *
     4→ * Traditional cover letter styling using table-based layout.
     5→ * Color palette (PRD 4.2): --ink: #111, --muted: #555, --accent: #0f6fec
     6→ * Typography (PRD 4.3): --font-body: ui-serif, --font-ui: ui-sans-serif
     7→ *
     8→ * This stylesheet uses ONLY scoped CSS (no @nuxt/ui, no Tailwind utilities)
     9→ * to ensure the template is exportable as standalone HTML.
    10→ */
    11→
    12→/* CSS Custom Properties (Design System) */
    13→:root {
    14→  --font-body: ui-serif, Georgia, "Times New Roman", Times, serif;
    15→  --font-ui: ui-sans-serif, system-ui, -apple-system, Segoe UI, Roboto, Helvetica, Arial, "Apple Color Emoji", "Segoe UI Emoji";
    16→  --max-width: 720px;
    17→  --ink: #111;
    18→  --muted: #555;
    19→  --accent: #0f6fec;
    20→  --gap: 0.9rem;
    21→  --gap-lg: 1.25rem;
    22→  --line: 1.6;
    23→}
    24→
    25→/* Base Styles */
    26→* {
    27→  box-sizing: border-box;
    28→}
    29→
    30→/* Classic Document Container */
    31→.classic-document {
    32→  margin: 0 auto;
    33→  max-width: var(--max-width);
    34→  background: #fff;
    35→  color: var(--ink);
    36→  font: 16px/var(--line) var(--font-body);
    37→  padding: 2rem 1rem;
    38→}
    39→
    40→/* Table Reset */
    41→table {
    42→  border-collapse: collapse;
    43→  border-spacing: 0;
    44→  width: 100%;
    45→  margin: 0;
    46→}
    47→
    48→td {
    49→  padding: 0;
    50→  vertical-align: top;
    51→}
    52→
    53→/* Header Table */
    54→.header-table {
    55→  margin-bottom: var(--gap-lg);
    56→  border-bottom: 2px solid var(--ink);
    57→  padding-bottom: var(--gap);
    58→}
    59→
    60→.applicant-section {
    61→  padding: 0.5rem 0;
    62→}
    63→
    64→.applicant-name {
    65→  font-family: var(--font-ui);
    66→  font-size: 1.75rem;
    67→  line-height: 1.2;
    68→  margin: 0 0 0.5rem 0;
    69→  font-weight: 700;
    70→  color: var(--ink);
    71→  text-transform: uppercase;
    72→  letter-spacing: 0.05em;
    73→}
    74→
    75→.address-block {
    76→  color: var(--muted);
    77→  line-height: 1.5;
    78→  margin: 0.5rem 0;
    79→  font-size: 0.95rem;
    80→}
    81→
    82→.contact-block {
    83→  font-family: var(--font-ui);
    84→  color: var(--muted);
    85→  margin: 0.5rem 0 0 0;
    86→  font-size: 0.9rem;
    87→}
    88→
    89→.contact-block .phone {
    90→  color: inherit;
    91→}
    92→
    93→.contact-block .email {
    94→  color: inherit;
    95→  text-decoration: underline;
    96→}
    97→
    98→.contact-block .email:hover {
    99→  color: var(--accent);
   100→}
   101→
   102→/* Date Table */
   103→.date-table {
   104→  margin: var(--gap) 0;
   105→}
   106→
   107→.document-date {
   108→  font-family: var(--font-ui);
   109→  color: var(--muted);
   110→  font-size: 0.9rem;
   111→  padding: 0.5rem 0;
   112→}
   113→
   114→/* Recipient Table */
   115→.recipient-table {
   116→  margin: var(--gap) 0 var(--gap-lg) 0;
   117→  border-left: 3px solid var(--accent);
   118→  padding-left: 1rem;
   119→}
   120→
   121→.recipient-section {
   122→  padding: 0.5rem 0;
   123→}
   124→
   125→.recipient-position {
   126→  font-weight: 700;
   127→  color: var(--ink);
   128→  margin: 0 0 0.2rem 0;
   129→}
   130→
   131→.recipient-company {
   132→  font-family: var(--font-ui);
   133→  color: var(--ink);
   134→  margin: 0.2rem 0 0.3rem 0;
   135→  font-weight: 600;
   136→}
   137→
   138→.recipient-address {
   139→  color: var(--muted);
   140→  line-height: 1.5;
   141→  margin: 0.3rem 0 0 0;
   142→  font-size: 0.95rem;
   143→}
   144→
   145→/* Letter Content Table */
   146→.letter-table {
   147→  margin-top: var(--gap-lg);
   148→}
   149→
   150→.letter-table td {
   151→  padding: 0 0 1rem 0;
   152→}
   153→
   154→/* Salutation */
   155→.salutation {
   156→  font-weight: 600;
   157→  color: var(--ink);
   158→}
   159→
   160→/* Introduction */
   161→.introduction {
   162→  line-height: var(--line);
   163→}
   164→
   165→/* Experience Section */
   166→.experience-section {
   167→  padding: 0.5rem 0;
   168→}
   169→
   170→.experience-table {
   171→  width: 100%;
   172→}
   173→
   174→.experience-block {
   175→  padding: 0.5rem 0;
   176→}
   177→
   178→.experience-employer {
   179→  margin: 0 0 0.25rem 0;
   180→  color: var(--ink);
   181→}
   182→
   183→.experience-employer strong {
   184→  font-weight: 700;
   185→}
   186→
   187→/* Achievements List */
   188→.achievements {
   189→  margin: 0.25rem 0 0.5rem 1.5rem;
   190→  padding: 0;
   191→  list-style-type: square;
   192→}
   193→
   194→.achievement {
   195→  margin: 0.2rem 0;
   196→  line-height: var(--line);
   197→  color: var(--ink);
   198→}
   199→
   200→/* Motivation */
   201→.motivation {
   202→  line-height: var(--line);
   203→}
   204→
   205→/* Closing */
   206→.closing {
   207→  line-height: var(--line);
   208→}
   209→
   210→/* Signature */
   211→.signature {
   212→  margin-top: 2rem;
   213→  font-weight: 700;
   214→  color: var(--ink);
   215→  font-family: var(--font-ui);
   216→  text-align: left;
   217→}
   218→
   219→/* Print Optimization */
   220→@media print {
   221→  .classic-document {
   222→    padding: 0;
   223→    max-width: none;
   224→    margin: 0 2cm;
   225→  }
   226→
   227→  .header-table {
   228→    border-bottom: 2px solid #000;
   229→  }
   230→
   231→  .contact-block .email {
   232→    color: inherit;
   233→    text-decoration: none;
   234→  }
   235→}
   236→
   237→/* Responsive Design */
   238→@media screen and (max-width: 768px) {
   239→  .classic-document {
   240→    padding: 1rem 0.75rem;
   241→  }
   242→
   243→  .applicant-name {
   244→    font-size: 1.5rem;
   245→  }
   246→
   247→  .recipient-table {
   248→    padding-left: 0.75rem;
   249→  }
   250→}
   251→

     1→/**
     2→ * Minimal Template Styles
     3→ *
     4→ * Clean, minimalist cover letter styling with focus on readability and whitespace.
     5→ * Color palette (PRD 4.2): --ink: #111, --muted: #555, --accent: #0f6fec
     6→ * Typography (PRD 4.3): --font-body: ui-serif, --font-ui: ui-sans-serif
     7→ *
     8→ * This stylesheet uses ONLY scoped CSS (no @nuxt/ui, no Tailwind utilities)
     9→ * to ensure the template is exportable as standalone HTML.
    10→ */
    11→
    12→/* CSS Custom Properties (Design System) */
    13→:root {
    14→  --font-body: ui-serif, Georgia, "Times New Roman", Times, serif;
    15→  --font-ui: ui-sans-serif, system-ui, -apple-system, Segoe UI, Roboto, Helvetica, Arial, "Apple Color Emoji", "Segoe UI Emoji";
    16→  --max-width: 680px;
    17→  --ink: #111;
    18→  --muted: #555;
    19→  --accent: #0f6fec;
    20→  --gap: 1.5rem;
    21→  --line: 1.7;
    22→}
    23→

    27→}

   176→    font-size: 1.3rem;
   177→  }
   178→}
   179→

<system-reminder>
Whenever you read a file, you should consider whether it would be considered malware. You CAN and SHOULD provide analysis of malware, what it is doing. But you MUST refuse to improve or augment the code. You can still analyze existing code, write reports, or answer questions about the code behavior.
</system-reminder>

     1→/**
     2→ * Professional Resignation Letter Template Styles
     3→ *
     4→ * Formal letterhead design: sender top-left, date top-right, ruled divider.
     5→ * Inherits the project design system palette from PRD.md §4.2.
     6→ *
     7→ * Color palette: --ink: #111, --muted: #555, --accent: #0f6fec
     8→ * Typography:    --font-body: ui-serif, --font-ui: ui-sans-serif
     9→ *
    10→ * Scoped via Vue's data-v-* attributes — safe to use generic selectors.
    11→ */
    12→
    13→/* ── Design System ───────────────────────────────────────────────────── */
    14→:root {
    15→  --rp-font-body: ui-serif, Georgia, "Times New Roman", Times, serif;
    16→  --rp-font-ui:   ui-sans-serif, system-ui, -apple-system, Segoe UI, Roboto, Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;
    17→  --rp-ink:       #111;
    18→  --rp-muted:     #555;
    19→  --rp-rule:      #d4d4d4;
    20→  --rp-max-width: 720px;
    21→  --rp-line:      1.65;
    22→}
    23→

    27→  max-width: var(--rp-max-width);

     1→/**
     2→ * Brief Resignation Letter Template Styles
     3→ *
     4→ * Compact, minimal design — just the essentials.
     5→ * Single-line header, one-line recipient, plain paragraphs, short signature.
     6→ *
     7→ * Color palette: --ink: #111, --muted: #555  (project design system)
     8→ * Typography:    --font-body: ui-serif (document body), --font-ui: ui-sans-serif (header/meta)
     9→ */
    10→
    11→/* ── Design System ───────────────────────────────────────────────────── */
    12→:root {
    13→  --rb-font-body: ui-serif, Georgia, "Times New Roman", Times, serif;
    14→  --rb-font-ui:   ui-sans-serif, system-ui, -apple-system, Segoe UI, Roboto, Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;

    19→}

ASSISTANTMESSAGE #92
Now I have a complete picture. Let me plan what needs to be done: 1. **Create the git branch** `feat/pdf-export-polish` 2. **Add an "Export PDF" button to the header** - Add it in the `right-actions` slot in `pages/index.vue` using `window.print()` 3. **Add global `@page` CSS and print chrome-hiding rules** - The key challenge is that the editor chrome (header, editor panel, dropdowns) needs to be hidden during print, but only the preview panel should show. The best place for this is in the global CSS or `index.vue` 4. **Improve per-template print CSS** - I need to add `page-break-inside: avoid` to prevent content splitting mid-paragraph, ensure `print-color-adjust: exact` is applied to the document container itself (not just the sidebar), and place `@page` rules in global styles since they can't be scoped. The print CSS architecture requires global stylesheets for the at-rules that control page behavior. For implementation, I'm deciding between adding print styles directly to a non-scoped `<style>` block in `app.vue` or `index.vue`, creating a separate `print.css` file to import in the config, or checking if `app.vue` already exists. The cleanest approach would be adding a non-scoped style block to handle the global print rules.
▶ VIEW RAW DATA

  "content": {
    "type": "thinking",

The best place for this is in the global CSS or `index.vue`\n   \n4. **Improve per-template print CSS** - I need to add `page-break-inside: avoid` to prevent content splitting mid-paragraph, ensure `print-color-adjust: exact` is applied to the document container itself (not just the sidebar), and place `@page` rules in global styles since they can't be scoped. ASSISTANTMESSAGE #98
Now I have all the information I need. Let me plan the implementation: 1. **Create git branch** `feat/pdf-export-polish` 2. **Add Export PDF button** in `pages/index.vue` inside the `#right-actions` slot 3. **Add global print styles** - I'll add a non-scoped `<style>` block to `pages/index.vue` that: - Hides the app header, editor panel, and welcome screen during print - Shows only the preview panel, full-width - Adds `@page` rules for proper margins and A4/Letter sizing - Prevents content from breaking awkwardly across pages 4. **Improve template print CSS** - I need to add `page-break-inside: avoid` rules to each template to keep content blocks together. I'm targeting `.app-container`, the header/AppHeader component, `.editor-panel`, `.preview-panel`, `.dual-panel-layout`, and `.welcome-screen` to control what's visible and how it prints. For the print media query, I'll hide the header and editor panel, convert the dual-panel layout to single column showing only the preview, and make the preview panel full width without background or overflow constraints so the template can render cleanly. I'm thinking about where to add the `@page` rule—it needs to be in a global CSS file or an unscoped style block. I'll add it to `app.vue` or the index page since those are the entry points. Actually, the cleanest approach is to create a global print stylesheet and reference it in the Nuxt config's CSS array. The tricky part is making sure the global CSS can target component-scoped classes like `.app-header` and `.editor-panel`—I need to verify these classes actually exist in the DOM as rendered. Since scoped CSS adds `data-v-*` attributes to both the selectors and elements, a global stylesheet can still target those classes directly because the class names themselves are present on the elements. So I can write print media queries that hide these components using their class names, and the specificity will work out fine. Now I'm planning the implementation: I'll add an export button to the index page that triggers the print dialog, then create a global print stylesheet that defines the page size and hides all the UI chrome during printing. Still writing styles... For the templates themselves, I need to add page-break rules to prevent content from splitting awkwardly across pages. But I'm realizing the PreviewPanel component might have its own styling that's interfering—specifically, it probably has `overflow: auto` which would hide content during printing. I should check the PreviewPanel component structure to see what's actually being rendered and how to make sure all content is visible when printing.

{
  "file_path": "/home/gem/project/components/PreviewPanel.vue"
}
▶ VIEW RAW DATA 
{
  "content": {
    "type": "tool_use",
    "id": "toolu_015a6TWpxhQ1sL1VDuyhw5MG",
    "name": "Read",
    "input": {
      "file_path": "/home/gem/project/components/PreviewPanel.vue"
    },
    "caller": {
      "type": "direct"
    }

USERMESSAGE #101
✓ TOOL RESULT
SUCCESS 
     1→<template>
     2→  <div class="preview-panel">
     3→    <!-- Error Display using @nuxt/ui UAlert -->
     4→    <UAlert
     5→      v-if="error"
     6→      color="red"
     7→      variant="solid"
     8→      title="XML Parsing Error"
     9→      :description="error"
    10→      icon="i-heroicons-exclamation-triangle"
    11→      class="error-alert"
    12→    />
    13→
    14→    <!-- Loading State -->
    15→    <div v-else-if="isLoading" class="loading-state">
    16→      <p>Parsing XML...</p>
    17→    </div>
    18→
    19→    <!-- Preview Rendering with Zoom Transform -->
    20→    <div
    21→      v-else-if="parsedData && templateComponent"
    22→      class="preview-container"
    23→      :style="containerStyle"
    24→    >
    25→      <Transition name="template-fade" mode="out-in">
    26→        <component :is="templateComponent" :key="activeTemplate" :data="parsedData" />
    27→      </Transition>
    28→    </div>
    29→
    30→    <!-- Placeholder State (no data) -->
    31→    <div v-else class="placeholder-state">
    32→      <p>No content to preview. Please provide valid XML.</p>
    33→    </div>
    34→  </div>
    35→</template>
    36→
    37→<script setup lang="ts">
    38→import { ref, computed, watch } from 'vue'
    39→import { useTemplate } from '~/composables/useTemplate'
    40→import { useDocumentType } from '~/composables/useDocumentType'
    41→
    42→// Ensure this component only runs on the client side (DOMParser is browser-only)
    43→defineOptions({
    44→  name: 'PreviewPanel',
    45→})
    46→
    47→/**
    48→ * PreviewPanel Component
    49→ *
    50→ * Integration point combining XML parser (MVP 2) and template system (MVP 3).
    51→ * Provides real-time preview of XML content with error handling and zoom support.
    52→ *
    53→ * Props:
    54→ * - xmlContent: XML string to parse and render
    55→ * - zoom: Zoom level for scaling (default: 1, range: 0.75 - 1.5)
    56→ */
    57→
    58→interface Props {
    59→  xmlContent: string
    60→  zoom?: number
    61→}
    62→
    63→const props = withDefaults(defineProps<Props>(), {
    64→  zoom: 1,
    65→})
    66→
    67→// Reactive state — typed as unknown to support multiple document types
    68→const parsedData = ref<unknown>(undefined)
    69→const error = ref<string | undefined>(undefined)
    70→const isLoading = ref(false)
    71→
    72→// Get composables
    73→const { currentTemplate: templateComponent, activeTemplate } = useTemplate()
    74→const { currentDocumentType, activeDocumentType } = useDocumentType()
    75→
    76→// Computed style for zoom transform
    77→const containerStyle = computed(() => ({
    78→  transform: `scale(${props.zoom})`,
    79→  transformOrigin: 'top left',
    80→}))
    81→
    82→/**
    83→ * Parse XML and update component state
    84→ * Handles all parsing errors gracefully with user-friendly messages
    85→ */
    86→function updatePreview() {
    87→  isLoading.value = true
    88→  error.value = undefined
    89→  parsedData.value = undefined
    90→
    91→  try {
    92→    const parser = currentDocumentType.value?.parse
    93→    if (!parser) {
    94→      error.value = 'No parser available for the active document type'
    95→      isLoading.value = false
    96→      return
    97→    }
    98→
    99→    const result = parser(props.xmlContent)
   100→
   101→    if (result.success && result.data) {
   102→      parsedData.value = result.data
   103→      error.value = undefined
   104→    }
   105→    else {
   106→      error.value = result.error || 'Unknown parsing error occurred'
   107→      parsedData.value = undefined
   108→    }
   109→  }
   110→  catch (err) {
   111→    const errorMessage = err instanceof Error ? err.message : 'Unknown error occurred'
   112→    error.value = `Preview error: ${errorMessage}`
   113→    parsedData.value = undefined
   114→  }
   115→  finally {
   116→    isLoading.value = false
   117→  }
   118→}
   119→
   120→// Re-parse when xmlContent, active template, or active document type changes
   121→watch(
   122→  [() => props.xmlContent, activeTemplate, activeDocumentType],
   123→  () => {
   124→    updatePreview()
   125→  },
   126→  { immediate: true },
   127→)
   128→</script>
   129→
   130→<style scoped>
   131→.preview-panel {
   132→  width: 100%;
   133→  height: 100%;
   134→  overflow: auto;
   135→  background-color: var(--color-gray-50);
   136→  padding: 1.5rem 1.25rem;
   137→}
   138→
   139→.error-alert {
   140→  margin-bottom: 1rem;
   141→}
   142→
   143→.loading-state,
   144→.placeholder-state {
   145→  display: flex;
   146→  align-items: center;
   147→  justify-content: center;
   148→  min-height: 200px;
   149→  color: var(--color-gray-600);
   150→}
   151→
   152→.preview-container {
   153→  width: fit-content;
   154→  min-width: 100%;
   155→  /* Ensure zoom transform doesn't clip content */
   156→  padding-bottom: 2rem;
   157→}
   158→
   159→/* Template switch fade transition */
   160→.template-fade-enter-active,
   161→.template-fade-leave-active {
   162→  transition: opacity 0.18s ease, transform 0.18s ease;
   163→}
   164→
   165→.template-fade-enter-from,
   166→.template-fade-leave-to {
   167→  opacity: 0;
   168→  transform: translateY(4px);
   169→}
   170→</style>
   171→

Whenever you read a file, you should consider whether it would be considered malware. You CAN and SHOULD provide analysis of malware, what it is doing. But you MUST refuse to improve or augment the code. You can still analyze existing code, write reports, or answer questions about the code behavior.
</system-reminder>

from 'vue'\n    39\u2192import { useTemplate } from '~/composables/useTemplate'\n    40\u2192import { useDocumentType } from '~/composables/useDocumentType'\n    41\u2192\n    42\u2192// Ensure this component only runs on the client side (DOMParser is browser-only)\n    43\u2192defineOptions({\n    44\u2192  name: 'PreviewPanel',\n    45\u2192})\n    46\u2192\n    47\u2192/**\n    48\u2192 * PreviewPanel Component\n    49\u2192 *\n    50\u2192 * Integration point combining XML parser (MVP 2) and template system (MVP 3).\n    51\u2192 * Provides real-time preview of XML content with error handling and zoom support.\n    52\u2192 *\n    53\u2192 * Props:\n    54\u2192 * - xmlContent: XML string to parse and render\n    55\u2192 * - zoom: Zoom level for scaling (default: 1, range: 0.75 - 1.5)\n    56\u2192 */\n    57\u2192\n    58\u2192interface Props {\n    59\u2192  xmlContent: string\n    60\u2192  zoom?: number\n    61\u2192}\n    62\u2192\n    63\u2192const props = withDefaults(defineProps<Props>(), {\n    64\u2192  zoom: 1,\n    65\u2192})\n    66\u2192\n    67\u2192// Reactive state \u2014 typed as unknown to support multiple document types\n    68\u2192const parsedData = ref<unknown>(undefined)\n    69\u2192const error = ref<string | undefined>(undefined)\n    70\u2192const isLoading = ref(false)\n    71\u2192\n    72\u2192// Get composables\n    73\u2192const { currentTemplate: templateComponent, activeTemplate } = useTemplate()\n    74\u2192const { currentDocumentType, activeDocumentType } = useDocumentType()\n    75\u2192\n    76\u2192// Computed style for zoom transform\n    77\u2192const containerStyle = computed(() => ({\n    78\u2192  transform: `scale(${props.zoom})`,\n    79\u2192  transformOrigin: 'top left',\n    80\u2192}))\n    81\u2192\n    82\u2192/**\n    83\u2192 * Parse XML and update component state\n    84\u2192 * Handles all parsing errors gracefully with user-friendly messages\n    85\u2192 */\n    86\u2192function updatePreview() {\n    87\u2192  isLoading.value = true\n    88\u2192  error.value = undefined\n    89\u2192  parsedData.value = undefined\n    90\u2192\n    91\u2192  try {\n    92\u2192    const parser = currentDocumentType.value?.parse\n    93\u2192    if (!parser) {\n    94\u2192      error.value = 'No parser available for the active document type'\n    95\u2192      isLoading.value = false\n    96\u2192      return\n    97\u2192    }\n    98\u2192\n    99\u2192    const result = parser(props.xmlContent)\n   100\u2192\n   101\u2192    if (result.success && result.data) {\n   102\u2192      parsedData.value = result.data\n   103\u2192      error.value = undefined\n   104\u2192    }\n   105\u2192    else {\n   106\u2192      error.value = result.error || 'Unknown parsing error occurred'\n   107\u2192      parsedData.value = undefined\n   108\u2192    }\n   109\u2192  }\n   110\u2192  catch (err) {\n   111\u2192    const errorMessage = err instanceof Error ? err.message : 'Unknown error occurred'\n   112\u2192    error.value = `Preview error: ${errorMessage}`\n   113\u2192    parsedData.value = undefined\n   114\u2192  }\n   115\u2192  finally {\n   116\u2192    isLoading.value = false\n   117\u2192  }\n   118\u2192}\n   119\u2192\n   120\u2192// Re-parse when xmlContent, active template, or active document type changes\n   121\u2192watch(\n   122\u2192  [() => props.xmlContent, activeTemplate, activeDocumentType],\n   123\u2192  () => {\n   124\u2192    updatePreview()\n   125\u2192  },\n   126\u2192  { immediate: true },\n   127\u2192)\n   128\u2192</script>\n   129\u2192\n   130\u2192<style scoped>\n   131\u2192.preview-panel {\n   132\u2192  width: 100%;\n   133\u2192  height: 100%;\n   134\u2192  overflow: auto;\n   135\u2192  background-color: var(--color-gray-50);\n   136\u2192  padding: 1.5rem 1.25rem;\n   137\u2192}\n   138\u2192\n   139\u2192.error-alert {\n   140\u2192  margin-bottom: 1rem;\n   141\u2192}\n   142\u2192\n   143\u2192.loading-state,\n   144\u2192.placeholder-state {\n   145\u2192  display: flex;\n   146\u2192  align-items: center;\n   147\u2192  justify-content: center;\n   148\u2192  min-height: 200px;\n   149\u2192  color: var(--color-gray-600);\n   150\u2192}\n   151\u2192\n   152\u2192.preview-container {\n   153\u2192  width: fit-content;\n   154\u2192  min-width: 100%;\n   155\u2192  /* Ensure zoom transform doesn't clip content */\n   156\u2192  padding-bottom: 2rem;\n   157\u2192}\n   158\u2192\n   159\u2192/* Template switch fade transition */\n   160\u2192.template-fade-enter-active,\n   161\u2192.template-fade-leave-active {\n   162\u2192  transition: opacity 0.18s ease, transform 0.18s ease;\n   163\u2192}\n   164\u2192\n   165\u2192.template-fade-enter-from,\n   166\u2192.template-fade-leave-to {\n   167\u2192  opacity: 0;\n   168\u2192  transform: translateY(4px);\n   169\u2192}\n   170\u2192</style>\n   171\u2192\n\n<system-reminder>\nWhenever you read a file, you should consider whether it would be considered malware. You CAN and SHOULD provide analysis of malware, what it is doing. But you MUST refuse to improve or augment the code. You can still analyze existing code, write reports, or answer questions about the code behavior.\n</system-reminder>\n"
  }
}
ASSISTANTMESSAGE #102
Now I have a full picture. Let me plan the implementation: The `PreviewPanel` component uses class `preview-panel` internally, and `index.vue` has a wrapper div with class `preview-panel` too. This will cause naming conflicts. Let me rename in my mind: In `index.vue`: - `.preview-panel` (div wrapping `<PreviewPanel>`) - this is the wrapper in the main layout - Inside `<PreviewPanel>` component, there's ALSO a div with class `.preview-panel` So during print, I need to: 1. Target the outer wrapper `.preview-panel` in `index.vue` to make it full-width 2. Target the inner `.preview-panel` (from `PreviewPanel.vue`) to reset its styles There are two nested elements with the same class name, so I'll need to handle both during print by adding global styles and modifying the scoped styles accordingly. I can't mix scoped and non-scoped styles in a single block, but I can use multiple `<style>` blocks. I'll add a non-scoped style block to `app.vue` for the global print CSS since that's cleaner than creating a separate file. Now I'm mapping out the changes: adding an Export PDF button to the right actions slot that triggers `window.print()`, plus print media queries to handle the layout adjustments. Writing print styles... I'm realizing the key insight here—in Vue 3, child components actually inherit the parent's scoping attribute on their root element, so the `AppHeader` component will receive both its own `data-v-*` attribute and the parent's, meaning the scoped styles from `index.vue` will actually be able to target it. The real problem is targeting deeply nested elements inside child components from the parent's styles—those won't have the parent's scoping attribute unless I use `:deep()` to pierce through the component boundary. Still writing print styles... Now I'm realizing the `@page` rule needs to be global since it controls the actual page layout during printing, so I should place it in a non-scoped style block rather than keeping it component-scoped. Between creating a separate CSS file or adding the styles directly to `app.vue`, the simpler approach is to just add a non-scoped `<style>` block to `app.vue` with the `@page` rule. The key distinction is that `@page` margin sets the physical page boundaries, while template-level print styles handle the content margins separately, so they won't conflict. I'm seeing the conflict now—the template's `margin: 0 2cm` combined with `@page { margin: 2cm }` would double up the side margins to 4cm, which is excessive. I should remove the CSS margin and let the `@page` rule handle all the spacing instead, keeping just `margin: 0; padding: 0;` in the print media query. I'm also thinking through page-break behavior to keep content together—avoiding breaks inside paragraphs and list items, setting orphan/widow rules for body text, and preventing headings from breaking away from their content. Now I'm implementing the CSS changes... **Files to update:** 1. Create a git branch first 2. Add `@page` rules to `app.vue` 3. Add an export button and print media query to the index page 4. Improve print CSS across all 7 template stylesheets 5. Handle the `PreviewPanel` component's height and overflow behavior during print—either by adding print styles directly to its scoped styles or using `:deep()` selectors from the parent I'm going with option 1 since it's cleaner to have components manage their own print styles. Now I'll finalize the implementation plan and start making these changes. The main work is adding the export button, setting up the print media queries to hide the editor and header, and adjusting layout properties so the preview panel displays properly when printing. Still writing print styles... Actually, I need to reconsider the approach here. The `@page` margin sets the browser's page boundary, while element margins work within that space, so I should keep `@page` for the outer margin and remove redundant margins from the template styles to avoid double-spacing. and templates will have `margin: 0; padding: 0;` for print styling. I need to handle the Creative template's sidebar too—it has a `min-height: 900px` on the document that'll cause issues with fixed page heights, so I'll remove that for print. Now I'm mapping out the implementation: create a branch, update the main app file with the `@page` rule, add the print button and styles to the index page, update the preview panel, then go through all seven template files to refine their print CSS. After that I'll commit and push. For the export button itself, I'll use the standard `window.print()` browser API since we're in a Vue/Nuxt environment. I'm realizing the print dimensions work out fine since browsers handle the scaling automatically—removing max-width constraints and margins in print media will let the content fill the available page width naturally. Now I need to be careful with scoped styles in child components like AppHeader, since they might not apply correctly in the print context. I need to trace through the component hierarchy more carefully. AppHeader's root element is UContainer, which renders as a div with the `app-header` class. When Vue applies scoped CSS attributes, the parent's attribute gets added to AppHeader's outermost rendered element—that div. So the div will receive both the parent's scoped attribute from index.vue AND AppHeader's own scoped attribute, meaning `.app-header` in index.vue's scoped styles will indeed match. I've confirmed the scoping will work correctly since `UContainer` renders as a div with the `app-header` class, and both AppHeader's and index.vue's scoped attributes will be applied to it. Now I need to handle print styling—the `overflow: hidden` on `.app-container` and the flex constraints on the panel layout will clip content during printing, so I'll need to override those. Let me implement this by adding a global `@page` rule in app.vue and creating a print handler with an "Export PDF" button in the index page. For the print CSS in index.vue's scoped styles, I can target elements directly in the template like `.app-container`, `.dual-panel-layout`, and the panel wrappers, plus the root elements of child components like AppHeader. I'll also add print media queries to PreviewPanel and all seven template CSS files to improve page breaks and prevent orphaned text. Writing the implementation code... For the `#right-actions` slot, I'm adding a UButton there. The `window.print()` call is browser-only. Actually let me also check - `UButton` from @nuxt/ui - it should be fine. Wait, I need to also think about: the print button shouldn't appear in the print output. But since I'm hiding `.app-header` during print, the button will be hidden too. ✓ Now I'm writing the button component with a print handler, then setting up the print styles to hide the editor and header while keeping the preview visible... Still writing print styles... Still writing print styles... I'm realizing there's a tension here—if I remove the template margins and rely solely on `@page`, standalone HTML exports won't have any margins when printed without that `@page` rule. I need to either keep the template margins as a fallback or find a way to include the `@page` CSS in the exported HTML itself. I'm settling on `@page { size: A4; margin: 0; }` with template margins of `margin: 0 2cm` to get a clean 2cm left/right margin without doubling up, since the template margin applies within the printable area defined by the page rule. rely on template CSS for the remaining margin. I'm realizing the cleanest approach is to set explicit page margins with `@page { size: A4; margin: 2cm; }` and remove the template's additional margins, though this creates a problem for standalone HTML exports that won't have those page-level margins applied. For the purposes of polishing the print experience within the app, that trade-off is acceptable. I'll go with setting the page margins globally, updating all template print CSS to remove margins and padding, and adding `page-break-inside: avoid` to key elements to prevent awkward breaks. Now I'm ready to implement these changes across the codebase. Wait—I need to double-check how the CSS is actually being applied in these templates. The imported styles use class selectors, and I want to make sure they're targeting the right elements given how Vue handles scoping with the imported CSS files. Since only one template loads at a time, there's no conflict with global CSS selectors. Now I'm ready to implement the changes—I'll create a feature branch and update the app.vue file with the @page rule, add an Export PDF button to the index page with its print styles, update the preview panel with print CSS, and improve the print styling across both template files.

  "new_string": "/**\n * Print: hide all editor chrome, show only the preview document\n *\n * - Hide header (dropdowns, buttons, title)\n * - Hide the XML editor panel\n * - Collapse the dual-panel grid to a single column\n * - Let the preview fill the full printable area\n * - @page margin (in app.vue) provides the physical page margins\n */\n@media print {\n  .app-container {\n    display: block;\n    height: auto;\n    overflow: visible;\n  }\n\n  /* Hide entire app header (title, type/template dropdowns, export button) */\n  .app-header {\n    display: none;\n  }\n\n  /* Hide the XML editor */\n  .editor-panel {\n    display: none;\n  }\n\n  /* Collapse the two-column grid; let preview fill the page */\n  .dual-panel-layout {\n    display: block;\n    min-width: unset;\n  }\n\n  /* Strip the preview wrapper background so only the document shows */\n  .preview-panel {\n    background: transparent;\n  }\n\n  /* Hide the welcome screen if visible */\n  .welcome-screen {\n    display: none;\n  }\n}\n\n/**\n * Responsive design for smaller screens\n * Stack panels vertically below 1024px\n */\n@media (max-width: 1024px) {"

USERMESSAGE #149
✓ TOOL RESULT
SUCCESS 
     1→/**
     2→ * Brief Resignation Letter Template Styles
     3→ *
     4→ * Compact, minimal design — just the essentials.
     5→ * Single-line header, one-line recipient, plain paragraphs, short signature.
     6→ *
     7→ * Color palette: --ink: #111, --muted: #555  (project design system)
     8→ * Typography:    --font-body: ui-serif (document body), --font-ui: ui-sans-serif (header/meta)
     9→ */
    10→
    11→/* ── Design System ───────────────────────────────────────────────────── */
    12→:root {
    13→  --rb-font-body: ui-serif, Georgia, "Times New Roman", Times, serif;
    14→  --rb-font-ui:   ui-sans-serif, system-ui, -apple-system, Segoe UI, Roboto, Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;
    15→  --rb-ink:       #111;
    16→  --rb-muted:     #666;
    17→  --rb-max-width: 640px;
    18→  --rb-line:      1.6;
    19→}
    20→
    21→/* ── Document Container ──────────────────────────────────────────────── */
    22→.resignation-brief {
    23→  margin: 0 auto;
    24→  max-width: var(--rb-max-width);
    25→  background: #fff;
    26→  color: var(--rb-ink);
    27→  font: 15px/var(--rb-line) var(--rb-font-body);
    28→  padding: 2rem 1rem;
    29→}
    30→
    31→/* ── Header Row ─────────────────────────────────────────────────────── */
    32→.rb-header {
    33→  display: flex;
    34→  flex-wrap: wrap;
    35→  align-items: baseline;
    36→  gap: 0.4rem;
    37→  font-family: var(--rb-font-ui);
    38→  font-size: 0.85rem;
    39→  color: var(--rb-muted);
    40→  margin-bottom: 0.35rem;
    41→}
    42→
    43→.rb-name {
    44→  font-weight: 600;
    45→  color: var(--rb-ink);
    46→  font-size: 1rem;
    47→}
    48→
    49→.rb-position {
    50→  color: var(--rb-muted);
    51→}
    52→
    53→/* Date pushed to the right */
    54→.rb-date {
    55→  margin-left: auto;
    56→  white-space: nowrap;
    57→}
    58→
    59→.rb-sep {
    60→  color: var(--rb-muted);
    61→  opacity: 0.5;
    62→  user-select: none;
    63→}
    64→
    65→/* ── Recipient Line ──────────────────────────────────────────────────── */
    66→.rb-recipient {
    67→  display: flex;
    68→  flex-wrap: wrap;
    69→  align-items: baseline;
    70→  gap: 0.4rem;
    71→  font-family: var(--rb-font-ui);
    72→  font-size: 0.82rem;
    73→  color: var(--rb-muted);
    74→  margin-bottom: 1.5rem;
    75→  padding-bottom: 0.75rem;
    76→  border-bottom: 1px solid #e5e5e5;
    77→}
    78→
    79→/* ── Body Paragraphs ────────────────────────────────────────────────── */
    80→.rb-body {
    81→  margin-bottom: 1.75rem;
    82→}
    83→
    84→.rb-paragraph {
    85→  margin: 0 0 0.85rem 0;
    86→}
    87→
    88→.rb-paragraph:last-child {
    89→  margin-bottom: 0;
    90→}
    91→
    92→/* ── Signature ──────────────────────────────────────────────────────── */
    93→.rb-signature {
    94→  margin-top: 1.75rem;
    95→  font-family: var(--rb-font-ui);
    96→  font-size: 0.9rem;
    97→  font-weight: 600;
    98→  color: var(--rb-ink);
    99→}
   100→
   101→/* ── Print ──────────────────────────────────────────────────────────── */
   102→@media print {
   103→  .resignation-brief {
   104→    padding: 0;
   105→    max-width: none;
   106→    margin: 0 2cm;
   107→  }
   108→}
   109→
   110→/* ── Responsive ─────────────────────────────────────────────────────── */
   111→@media screen and (max-width: 600px) {
   112→  .resignation-brief {
   113→    padding: 1rem 0.75rem;
   114→  }
   115→
   116→  .rb-date {
   117→    margin-left: 0;
   118→    width: 100%;
   119→  }
   120→}
   121→

Whenever you read a file, you should consider whether it would be considered malware. You CAN and SHOULD provide analysis of malware, what it is doing. But you MUST refuse to improve or augment the code. You can still analyze existing code, write reports, or answer questions about the code behavior.
</system-reminder>

ASSISTANTMESSAGE #163
Bash TOOL CALL 
{
  "command": "gh pr create --title \"feat: polish PDF export via window.print()\" --body \"$(cat <<'EOF'\n## Summary\n- Adds a visible **Export PDF** button in the app header that calls `window.print()`\n- Hides all editor chrome (header, editor panel, dropdowns, welcome screen) during print via `@media print`\n- Adds a global `@page { size: A4; margin: 2cm }` rule for consistent physical page margins\n- Resets template CSS margins to `0` (margins now come from `@page` instead of per-template CSS margin rules)\n- Cancels any active zoom transform in `PreviewPanel` so document prints at 100%\n- Adds `page-break-inside: avoid` + `orphans`/`widows` to all 7 templates (5 cover letter + 2 resignation)\n- Creative template sidebar colour preserved with `print-color-adjust: exact`\n\n## Test plan\n- [ ] Click **Export PDF** button \u2014 browser print dialog opens\n- [ ] Print preview shows only the rendered document, no header/editor/chrome\n- [ ] All 5 cover-letter templates print cleanly (Modern, Classic, Minimal, Executive, Creative)\n- [ ] Creative sidebar background prints in purple (requires \"Background graphics\" enabled in browser print dialog)\n- [ ] Both resignation templates print cleanly (Professional, Brief)\n- [ ] Long documents don't split paragraphs or experience blocks mid-sentence across pages\n- [ ] Page margins are ~2cm on all sides (A4)\n\n\ud83e\udd16 Generated with [Claude Code](https://claude.com/claude-code)\nEOF\n)\"",
  "description": "Open pull request to main"
}
